PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================


ENVIRONMENT
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain tower-of-hanoi)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?l2 - (either disk peg)) ; d1 is on l2 (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - (either disk peg)) ; Nothing is on x\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2\n    )\n\n    ; 1. Move disk D from disk D_BELOW to disk D_TARGET\n    ; Preconditions ensure D is clear, on D_below, D_target is clear, and D < D_target.\n    (:action move-disk-disk-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_below - disk ?d_target - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_below)\n            (clear ?d_target)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_target)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below))\n            (not (clear ?d_target))\n            (clear ?d_below)\n            (on ?d ?d_target)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ; 2. Move disk D from disk D_BELOW to peg P_TARGET\n    ; Peg P_target is always considered infinitely large, so no size constraint needed.\n    (:action move-disk-disk-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_below - disk ?p_target - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_below)\n            (clear ?p_target) ; P_TARGET must be empty/clear base\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below))\n            (clear ?d_below)\n            (not (clear ?p_target))\n            (on ?d ?p_target)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 3. Move disk D from peg P_BELOW to disk D_TARGET\n    ; Preconditions ensure D is clear, on P_below, D_target is clear, and D < D_target.\n    (:action move-disk-peg-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_below - peg ?d_target - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?p_below)\n            (clear ?d_target)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_target)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_below))\n            (clear ?p_below) \n            (not (clear ?d_target))\n            (on ?d ?d_target)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 4. Move disk D from peg P_BELOW to peg P_TARGET\n    ; Moving the bottom disk from one stack/peg base to another empty peg base.\n    (:action move-disk-peg-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_below - peg ?p_target - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?p_below)\n            (clear ?p_target) ; P_TARGET must be empty/clear base\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_below))\n            (clear ?p_below) \n            (not (clear ?p_target))\n            (on ?d ?p_target)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:domain tower-of-hanoi)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; Size relations: A < B < C < D < E (A smallest, E largest)\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ; Initial state: Stack A/B/C/D/E on Middle (M).\n        ; A (top) on B on C on D on E (bottom). E on M.\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E M)\n\n        ; Clear status\n        (clear A) ; Top disk\n        (clear L) ; Empty peg\n        (clear R) ; Empty peg\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Final stack A/B/C/D/E on Right (R)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E R)\n        \n        ; L and M must be empty\n        (clear L)\n        (clear M)\n    ))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_1
------------------------------
This is a plan to solve the Tower of Hanoi puzzle involving 5 disks (A, B, C, D, E) and 3 pegs (L, M, R), moving the stack from Peg M to Peg R. Disk A is the smallest and E is the largest.

### **Plan for Tower of Hanoi (5 Disks: M -> R)**

1.  Move disk A from on top of disk B to peg L.
2.  Move disk B from on top of disk C to peg R.
3.  Move disk A from peg L onto disk B.
4.  Move disk C from on top of disk D to peg L.
5.  Move disk A from on top of disk B onto disk D.
6.  Move disk B from peg R onto disk C.
7.  Move disk A from on top of disk D onto disk B.
8.  Move disk A from on top of disk B to peg R.
9.  Move disk B from on top of disk C onto disk D.
10. Move disk A from peg R onto disk B.
11. Move disk C from peg L to peg R.
12. Move disk A from on top of disk B to peg L.
13. Move disk B from on top of disk D onto disk C.
14. Move disk A from peg L onto disk B.
15. Move disk D from on top of disk E to peg L.
16. Move disk A from on top of disk B onto disk E.
17. Move disk A from on top of disk E onto disk D.
18. Move disk B from on top of disk C onto disk E.
19. Move disk A from on top of disk D onto disk B.
20. Move disk C from peg R onto disk D.
21. Move disk A from on top of disk B to peg R.
22. Move disk B from on top of disk E onto disk C.
23. Move disk A from peg R onto disk B.
24. Move disk E from peg M to peg R.
25. Move disk A from on top of disk B to peg M.
26. Move disk B from on top of disk C onto disk E.
27. Move disk A from peg M onto disk B.
28. Move disk C from on top of disk D to peg M.
29. Move disk A from on top of disk B onto disk D.
30. Move disk B from on top of disk E onto disk C.
31. Move disk A from on top of disk D onto disk B.
32. Move disk D from peg L onto disk E.
33. Move disk A from on top of disk B to peg L.
34. Move disk A from peg L onto disk D.
35. Move disk B from on top of disk C to peg L.
36. Move disk A from on top of disk D onto disk B.
37. Move disk C from peg M onto disk D.
38. Move disk A from on top of disk B to peg M.
39. Move disk B from peg L onto disk C.
40. Move disk A from peg M onto disk B.
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the left peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain blocksworld)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :action-costs)\n    (:types block)\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?x - block ?y - block)\n        (on-table ?x - block)\n        (clear ?x - block)\n        (hand-empty)\n        (holding ?x - block)\n    )\n\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost) - number\n    )\n\n    ;; Action to pick up a block from the table\n    (:action pick-up\n        :parameters (?x - block)\n        :precondition (and (clear ?x) (on-table ?x) (hand-empty))\n        :effect (and (not (on-table ?x))\n                     (not (hand-empty))\n                     (holding ?x)\n                     (increase (total-cost) 1)\n                )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action to put down a block onto the table\n    (:action put-down\n        :parameters (?x - block)\n        :precondition (holding ?x)\n        :effect (and (not (holding ?x))\n                     (hand-empty)\n                     (on-table ?x)\n                     (clear ?x)\n                     (increase (total-cost) 1)\n                )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action to stack block ?x onto block ?y\n    (:action stack\n        :parameters (?x - block ?y - block)\n        :precondition (and (holding ?x) (clear ?y))\n        :effect (and (not (holding ?x))\n                     (not (clear ?y))\n                     (hand-empty)\n                     (on ?x ?y)\n                     (increase (total-cost) 1)\n                )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action to unstack block ?x from block ?y\n    :action unstack\n        :parameters (?x - block ?y - block)\n        :precondition (and (on ?x ?y) (clear ?x) (hand-empty))\n        :effect (and (not (on ?x ?y))\n                     (not (hand-empty))\n                     (clear ?y)\n                     (holding ?x)\n                     (increase (total-cost) 1)\n                )\n    )\n)",

block ?b2 - block)\n        (on_table ?b - block)\n        (clear ?b - block)\n        (holding ?b - block)\n        (hand_empty)\n    )\n\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ;; Pick up a block from the table (must be clear and hand empty)\n    (:action pick-up\n        :parameters (?b - block)\n        :precondition (and \n            (clear ?b)\n            (on_table ?b)\n            (hand_empty)\n        )\n        :effect (and \n            (not (on_table ?b))\n            (not (hand_empty))\n            (holding ?b)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Put down a block onto the table\n    (:action put-down\n        :parameters (?b - block)\n        :precondition (holding ?b)\n        :effect (and \n            (not (holding ?b))\n            (clear ?b)\n            (on_table ?b)\n            (hand_empty)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Stack a block B onto another block X (B is held, X must be clear)\n    (:action stack\n        :parameters (?b - block ?x - block)\n        :precondition (and \n            (holding ?b)\n            (clear ?x)\n            (not (= ?b ?x))\n        )\n        :effect (and \n            (not (holding ?b))\n            (not (clear ?x)) ; X is no longer clear\n            (clear ?b)       ; B becomes clear\n            (on ?b ?x)\n            (hand_empty)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Unstack a block B from another block X (B must be clear, hand empty)\n    (:action unstack\n        :parameters (?b - block ?x - block)\n        :precondition (and \n            (on ?b ?x)\n            (clear ?b)\n            (hand_empty)\n            (not (= ?b ?x))\n        )\n        :effect (and \n            (not (on ?b ?x))\n            (clear ?x)       ; X is now clear\n            (not (hand_empty))\n            (holding ?b)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)\n```\n\n### PDDL Problem\n\n```pddl\n(define (problem BlocksworldMediumScaling1-Problem)\n    (:domain blocksworld-medium-1)\n    (:objects\n        orange yellow blue red - ================================================================================


NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_6
------------------------------
This sequence of actions translates the PDDL plan into human-readable instructions to achieve the goal state of having the Red block on top of the Blue block.

| Step | Action (PDDL Translation) | Description |
| :---: | :--- | :--- |
| **1** | UNSTACK ORANGE from BLUE | Pick up the Orange block from on top of the Blue block. (The agent is now holding Orange.) |
| **2** | PUT-DOWN ORANGE | Place the Orange block down onto the Table. (Orange is now on the table; the hand is empty.) |
| **3** | UNSTACK YELLOW from RED | Pick up the Yellow block from on top of the Red block. (The agent is now holding Yellow.) |
| **4** | PUT-DOWN YELLOW | Place the Yellow block down onto the Table. (Yellow is now on the table; the hand is empty.) |
| **5** | PICK-UP RED | Pick up the Red block from the Table. (The agent is now holding Red.) |
| **6** | STACK RED onto BLUE | Place the Red block on top of the Blue block. (The final goal `on(red, blue)` is achieved.) |
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain TOWER-OF-HANOI)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n\n    (:predicates\n        ; Disk d is immediately on location l (disk or peg)\n        (on ?d - disk ?l - (either disk peg)) \n        \n        ; Nothing is on location x (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - (either disk peg))        \n        \n        ; d1 is smaller than d2 (Static knowledge base)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) \n    )\n    \n    ; Action 1: Move Disk D from Source L_FROM onto a PEG P_TO (must be clear/empty)\n    (:action move-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?l_from - (either disk peg) ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            ; D must be the top disk\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; D must be currently on L_from\n            (on ?d ?l_from)\n            \n            ; P_to must be empty\n            (clear ?p_to) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on ?d ?l_from))\n            (on ?d ?p_to)\n            \n            ; Update clear status\n            (clear ?l_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to)) ; Peg is no longer clear if it has a disk\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 2: Move Disk D from Source L_FROM onto a DISK D_TO (must be clear, size check)\n    (:action move-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?l_from - (either disk peg) ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            ; D must be the top disk\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; D must be currently on L_from\n            (on ?d ?l_from)\n            \n            ; D_to must be the top of its stack\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            \n            ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than D_to\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on ?d ?l_from))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            \n            ; Update clear status\n            (clear ?l_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to)) ; D_to is no longer clear\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem HANOI-5-DISK-L-TO-R)\n    (:domain TOWER-OF-HANOI)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk ; Smallest A, Largest E\n        L M R - peg      ; Left, Middle, Right\n    )\n    \n    (:init\n        ; --- Static size relations (A < B < C < D < E) ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ; --- Initial Configuration: L holds A, B, C, D, E (top to bottom) ---\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E L) \n\n        ; Clear status\n        (clear A) ; A is on top\n        (clear M) ; M is empty\n        (clear R) ; R is empty\n        \n        ; Implicitly: B, C, D, E, L are not clear\n    )\n\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Final Configuration: R holds A, B, C, D, E (top to bottom)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E R)\n        \n        ; Pegs L and M must be empty\n        (clear L)\n        (clear M)\n    ))\n)",

Here is the action I can do\n\nMove the top disk from one peg to another peg\n\nI must obey the following rules:\nI can move only one disk at a time.\nI may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.\nI can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.\nOnce a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.\n\n[STATEMENT]\nThere are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the right peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the middle peg are empty again.\nThe middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

    "human_specification": "I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do\n\nMove the top disk from one peg to another peg\n\nI must obey the following rules:\nI can move only one disk at a time.\nI may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.\nI can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.\nOnce a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.\n\n[STATEMENT]\nThere are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the right peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the middle peg are empty again.\nThe middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

                "Available actions include: Pick up a block (from table), Unstack a block (from another block), Put down a block (onto table), Stack a block (onto another block).",
                "Action Constraints:",
                "1. Hand Status: Only one block can be held at a time. Hand must be empty to pick up or unstack.",
                "2. Clear Condition: A block must be 'clear' (no blocks on top) to be picked up or unstacked.",
                "3. Pick Up (Block X): Requires X is on the table and X is clear. Effects: Hand holds X, X is no longer on table, hand is no longer empty.",
                "4. Unstack (Block X from Block Y): Requires X is on Y and X is clear and hand is empty. Effects: Hand holds X, Y becomes clear, X is no longer on Y, hand is no longer empty.",
                "5. Put Down (Block X): Requires hand holds X. Effects: Hand becomes empty, X is now on the table, X is clear.",
                "6. Stack (Block X onto Block Y): Requires hand holds X and Y is clear. Effects: Hand becomes empty, X is on Y, Y is no longer clear.",
                "Initial State (Predicates): (clear Red), (clear Orange), (handempty), (on Blue Yellow), (on Orange Blue), (ontable Red), (ontable Yellow).",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain Hanoi5Disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk \n        peg ; Pegs L, M, R act as base locations\n    )\n    \n    (:predicates\n        (on ?x - disk ?y - disk)     ; X is on Y\n        (on-base ?x - disk ?p - peg) ; X is the lowest disk on peg P\n        (clear ?x - disk)            ; X has nothing on it (movable)\n        (clear-base ?p - peg)        ; Peg P base is available (empty)\n        \n        ; Size ordering: (smaller X Y) means X can be placed on Y\n        (smaller ?x - disk ?y - disk) \n    )\n\n    ; ---------------------------------------------------\n    ; 1. Move D from Disk D_S onto Disk D_T\n    ; Source D is resting on another disk D_S. Target D_T is another disk.\n    (:action move-disk-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_s - disk ?d_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_s)\n            (clear ?d_t)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_t) ; Hanoi size rule\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (on ?d ?d_t)\n            (clear ?d_s)\n            (not (on ?d ?d_s))\n            (not (clear ?d_t))\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ; ---------------------------------------------------\n    ; 2. Move D from Disk D_S onto Peg Base P_T\n    ; Source D is resting on disk D_S. Target P_T is an empty peg base.\n    (:action move-disk-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_s - disk ?p_t - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_s)\n            (clear-base ?p_t) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (on-base ?d ?p_t)\n            (clear ?d_s)\n            (not (on ?d ?d_s))\n            (not (clear-base ?p_t))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; ---------------------------------------------------\n    ; 3. Move D from Peg Base P_S onto Disk D_T\n    ; Source D is resting on P_S base. Target D_T is another disk.\n    (:action move-base-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_s - peg ?d_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on-base ?d ?p_s)\n            (clear ?d_t)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_t) ; Hanoi size rule\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (on ?d ?d_t)\n            (clear-base ?p_s) ; P_S is now empty\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p_s))\n            (not (clear ?d_t))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; ---------------------------------------------------\n    ; 4. Move D from Peg Base P_S onto Peg Base P_T\n    ; Source D is resting on P_S base. Target P_T is an empty peg base.\n    (:action move-base-to-base\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_s - peg ?p_t - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on-base ?d ?p_s)\n            (clear-base ?p_t)\n            (not (= ?p_s ?p_t)) ; Must move between distinct pegs\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (on-base ?d ?p_t)\n            (clear-base ?p_s)\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p_s))\n            (not (clear-base ?p_t))\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem Hanoi-5-L-to-R)\n    (:domain Hanoi5Disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk ; A=smallest, E=largest\n        L M R - peg      ; Left, Middle, Right\n    )\n    \n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Ordering (A < B < C < D < E) ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; --- Initial Stacking: L holds A (top) through E (bottom) ---\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E L)\n        \n        ; --- Initial Clear Status ---\n        (clear A) \n        (clear-base M) ; Middle peg empty\n        (clear-base R) ; Right peg empty\n        ; Peg L is not clear-base because E is on it\n        ; Disks B, C, D, E are not clear because they are covered\n    )\n\n    (:goal (and\n        ; --- Goal Stacking: R holds A (top) through E (bottom) ---\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E R)\n        \n        ; --- Ensure all pegs are correctly utilized/cleared ---\n        (clear A)\n        (clear-base L) ; Left peg empty\n        (clear-base M) ; Middle peg empty\n    ))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",
    "pddl_plan": "(move-disk-to-peg a b m)\n(move-disk-to-peg b c r)\n(move-base-to-disk a m b)\n(move-disk-to-peg c d m)\n(move-disk-to-disk a b d)\n(move-base-to-disk b r c)\n(move-disk-to-disk a d b)\n(move-disk-to-peg a b r)\n(move-disk-to-disk b c d)\n(move-base-to-disk a r b)\n(move-base-to-base c m r)\n(move-disk-to-peg a b m)\n(move-disk-to-disk b d c)\n(move-base-to-disk a m b)\n(move-disk-to-peg d e m)\n(move-disk-to-disk a b e)\n(move-disk-to-disk a e d)\n(move-disk-to-disk b c e)\n(move-disk-to-disk a d b)\n(move-base-to-disk c r d)\n(move-disk-to-peg a b r)\n(move-disk-to-disk b e c)\n(move-base-to-disk a r b)\n(move-base-to-base e l r)\n(move-disk-to-peg a b l)\n(move-disk-to-disk b c e)\n(move-base-to-disk a l b)\n(move-disk-to-peg c d l)\n(move-disk-to-disk a b d)\n(move-disk-to-disk b e c)\n(move-disk-to-disk a d b)\n(move-base-to-disk d m e)\n(move-disk-to-peg a b m)\n(move-base-to-disk a m d)\n(move-disk-to-peg b c m)\n(move-disk-to-disk a d b)\n(move-base-to-disk c l d)\n(move-disk-to-peg a b l)\n(move-base-to-disk b m c)\n(move-base-to-disk a l b)\n; cost = 40 (unit cost)\n",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_4
------------------------------
This sequence of instructions translates the PDDL plan for moving the stack of 5 disks (A being the smallest, E the largest) from the Left Peg (L) to the Right Peg (R), using the Middle Peg (M) as auxiliary.

The initial state has disks A, B, C, D, E stacked sequentially on Peg L (A on top of B, ..., E on the base of L).

| Step | Action Type | Source Location | Target Location | Instruction |
| :---: | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk B (on L) | Peg M | Move disk A (from disk B) to the base of Peg M. |
| 2 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk C (on L) | Peg R | Move disk B (from disk C) to the base of Peg R. |
| 3 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg M | Disk B (on R) | Move disk A (from the base of Peg M) onto disk B. |
| 4 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk D (on L) | Peg M | Move disk C (from disk D) to the base of Peg M. |
| 5 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk B (on R) | Disk D (on L) | Move disk A (from disk B) onto disk D. |
| 6 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg R | Disk C (on M) | Move disk B (from the base of Peg R) onto disk C. |
| 7 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk D (on L) | Disk B (on M) | Move disk A (from disk D) onto disk B. |
| 8 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk B (on M) | Peg R | Move disk A (from disk B) to the base of Peg R. |
| 9 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk C (on M) | Disk D (on L) | Move disk B (from disk C) onto disk D. |
| 10 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg R | Disk B (on D) | Move disk A (from the base of Peg R) onto disk B. |
| 11 | `move-base-to-base`| Peg M | Peg R | Move disk C (from the base of Peg M) to the base of Peg R. |
| 12 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk B (on D) | Peg M | Move disk A (from disk B) to the base of Peg M. |
| 13 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk D (on L) | Disk C (on R) | Move disk B (from disk D) onto disk C. |
| 14 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg M | Disk B (on C) | Move disk A (from the base of Peg M) onto disk B. |
| 15 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk E (on L) | Peg M | Move disk D (from disk E) to the base of Peg M. |
| 16 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk B (on C) | Disk E (on L) | Move disk A (from disk B) onto disk E. |
| 17 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk E (on L) | Disk D (on M) | Move disk A (from disk E) onto disk D. |
| 18 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk C (on R) | Disk E (on L) | Move disk B (from disk C) onto disk E. |
| 19 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk D (on M) | Disk B (on E) | Move disk A (from disk D) onto disk B. |
| 20 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg R | Disk D (on M) | Move disk C (from the base of Peg R) onto disk D. |
| 21 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk B (on E) | Peg R | Move disk A (from disk B) to the base of Peg R. |
| 22 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk E (on L) | Disk C (on D) | Move disk B (from disk E) onto disk C. |
| 23 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg R | Disk B (on C) | Move disk A (from the base of Peg R) onto disk B. |
| 24 | `move-base-to-base`| Peg L | Peg R | Move disk E (from the base of Peg L) to the base of Peg R. |
| 25 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk B (on C) | Peg L | Move disk A (from disk B) to the base of Peg L. |
| 26 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk C (on D) | Disk E (on R) | Move disk B (from disk C) onto disk E. |
| 27 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg L | Disk B (on E) | Move disk A (from the base of Peg L) onto disk B. |
| 28 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk D (on M) | Peg L | Move disk C (from disk D) to the base of Peg L. |
| 29 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk B (on E) | Disk D (on L) | Move disk A (from disk B) onto disk D. |
| 30 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk E (on R) | Disk C (on L) | Move disk B (from disk E) onto disk C. |
| 31 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk D (on L) | Disk B (on C) | Move disk A (from disk D) onto disk B. |
| 32 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg M | Disk E (on R) | Move disk D (from the base of Peg M) onto disk E. |
| 33 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk B (on C) | Peg M | Move disk A (from disk B) to the base of Peg M. |
| 34 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg M | Disk D (on E) | Move disk A (from the base of Peg M) onto disk D. |
| 35 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk C (on L) | Peg M | Move disk B (from disk C) to the base of Peg M. |
| 36 | `move-disk-to-disk`| Disk D (on E) | Disk B (on M) | Move disk A (from disk D) onto disk B. |
| 37 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg L | Disk D (on E) | Move disk C (from the base of Peg L) onto disk D. |
| 38 | `move-disk-to-peg` | Disk B (on M) | Peg L | Move disk A (from disk B) to the base of Peg L. |
| 39 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg M | Disk C (on D) | Move disk B (from the base of Peg M) onto disk C. |
| 40 | `move-base-to-disk`| Peg L | Disk B (on C) | Move disk A (from the base of Peg L) onto disk B. |
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================


ENVIRONMENT
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

{

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_1
------------------------------
This is the sequence of human-readable actions required to achieve the goal state:

1. **Unstack R from Y:** Unstack the red block (R) from the yellow block (Y). (The hand is now holding R.)
2. **Put Down R:** Place the red block (R) onto the table. (The red block R is now clear, and the hand is empty.)
3. **Unstack Y from O:** Unstack the yellow block (Y) from the orange block (O). (The hand is now holding Y, and O is now clear.)
4. **Stack Y on R:** Stack the yellow block (Y) onto the red block (R). (Y is now on R, and the hand is empty.)
5. **Pick Up B:** Pick up the blue block (B) from the table. (The hand is now holding B.)
6. **Stack B on O:** Stack the blue block (B) onto the orange block (O). (B is now on O, and the goal is achieved.)
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the right peg and the middle peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the right peg are empty again.
The right peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

Here is the action I can do\n\nMove the top disk from one peg to another peg\n\nI must obey the following rules:\nI can move only one disk at a time.\nI may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.\nI can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.\nOnce a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.\n\n[STATEMENT]\nThere are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the right peg and the middle peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the right peg are empty again.\nThe right peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

                "block_mover.pddl->auditor.audit",

            ]
        }
    },
    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain blocksworld)\n  (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n  (:types\n    block table_object - object\n  )\n  (:constants\n    table - table_object\n  )\n  (:predicates\n    (on ?x - block ?y - (either block table_object))\n    (clear ?x - block)\n    (handempty)\n    (holding ?x - block)\n  )\n  (:functions\n    (total-cost) - number\n  )\n\n  (:action pickup\n    :parameters (?x - block)\n    :precondition (and (clear ?x) (on ?x table) (handempty))\n    :effect (and (not (clear ?x)) (not (on ?x table)) (not (handempty))\n                 (holding ?x)\n                 (increase (total-cost) 1)\n            )\n  )\n\n  (:action putdown\n    :parameters (?x - block)\n    :precondition (holding ?x)\n    :effect (and (clear ?x) (on ?x table) (handempty)\n                 (not (holding ?x))\n                 (increase (total-cost) 1)\n            )\n  )\n\n  (:action stack\n    :parameters (?x - block ?y - block)\n    :precondition (and (holding ?x) (clear ?y))\n    :effect (and (on ?x ?y) (clear ?x) (handempty)\n                 (not (holding ?x)) (not (clear ?y))\n                 (increase (total-cost) 1)\n            )\n  )\n\n  (:action unstack\n    :parameters (?x - block ?y - block)\n    :precondition (and (on ?x ?y) (clear ?x) (handempty))\n    :effect (and (not (on ?x ?y)) (not (clear ?x)) (not (handempty))\n                 (holding ?x) (clear ?y)\n                 (increase (total-cost) 1)\n            )\n  )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem BlocksworldMediumScaling4_problem)\n  (:domain blocksworld)\n  (:objects\n    red orange yellow blue - block\n  )\n  (:init\n    (= (total-cost) 0)\n    (handempty)\n\n    ; R on Y, O on B\n    (on red yellow)\n    (on orange blue)\n    \n    ; Y and B on table\n    (on yellow table)\n    (on blue table)\n\n    ; Clear blocks: R, O\n    (clear red)\n    (clear orange)\n  )\n  (:goal (and\n    (on red yellow)\n    (on yellow orange)\n  ))\n  (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disk)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk peg - location\n    )\n    \n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?l - location) ; Disk d is resting on location l (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?l - location)        ; Location l has nothing resting on it\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2 (static)\n    )\n\n    ; Action 1: Move disk D from L1 onto a Peg P2\n    (:action move-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?l1 - location ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?l1)   ; D must be resting on L1\n            (clear ?d)    ; D must be the topmost disk\n            (clear ?p2)   ; P2 must be clear (empty)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?l1))\n            (on ?d ?p2)\n            (clear ?l1)\n            (not (clear ?p2))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 2: Move disk D from L1 onto a Disk D2\n    (:action move-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?l1 - location ?d2 - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?l1)   ; D must be resting on L1\n            (clear ?d)    ; D must be the topmost disk\n            (clear ?d2)   ; D2 must be clear\n            (smaller ?d ?d2) ; D must be smaller than D2\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?l1))\n            (on ?d ?d2)\n            (clear ?l1)\n            (not (clear ?d2))\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disks-L-to-M)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disk)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    \n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Relations (A < B < C < D < E) ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ; --- Initial Stack: A/B/C/D/E on L (Top to Bottom) ---\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E L)\n\n        ; --- Clear status ---\n        (clear A) ; A is on top\n        (clear M) ; M is empty\n        (clear R) ; R is empty\n    )\n    \n    (:goal (and\n        ; --- Final Stack: A/B/C/D/E on M ---\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E M)\n        \n        ; --- Pegs L and R must be empty ---\n        (clear L)\n        (clear R)\n    ))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disk)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk peg - location\n    )\n    \n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?l - location) ; Disk d is resting on location l (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?l - location)        ; Location l has nothing resting on it\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2 (static)\n    )\n\n    ; Action 1: Move disk D from L1 onto a Peg P2\n    (:action move-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?l1 - location ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?l1)   ; D must be resting on L1\n            (clear ?d)    ; D must be the topmost disk\n            (clear ?p2)   ; P2 must be clear (empty)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?l1))\n            (on ?d ?p2)\n            (clear ?l1)\n            (not (clear ?p2))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 2: Move disk D from L1 onto a Disk D2\n    (:action move-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?l1 - location ?d2 - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?l1)   ; D must be resting on L1\n            (clear ?d)    ; D must be the topmost disk\n            (clear ?d2)   ; D2 must be clear\n            (smaller ?d ?d2) ; D must be smaller than D2\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?l1))\n            (on ?d ?d2)\n            (clear ?l1)\n            (not (clear ?d2))\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disks-L-to-M)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disk)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    \n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Relations (A < B < C < D < E) ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ; --- Initial Stack: A/B/C/D/E on L (Top to Bottom) ---\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E L)\n\n        ; --- Clear status ---\n        (clear A) ; A is on top\n        (clear M) ; M is empty\n        (clear R) ; R is empty\n    )\n    \n    (:goal (and\n        ; --- Final Stack: A/B/C/D/E on M ---\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on E M)\n        \n        ; --- Pegs L and R must be empty ---\n        (clear L)\n        (clear R)\n    ))\n)",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_5
------------------------------
This is the sequence of 40 instructions required to manipulate the disks according to the plan derived from the Towers of Hanoi problem definition.

The pegs are labeled Left (L), Middle (M), and Right (R). The disks are A (smallest) through E (largest). The goal is to move the entire stack of disks from Peg L to Peg M.

| Step | Action | Description |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | Move Disk A from Disk B | Move Disk A (smallest) from its current resting place (Disk B) onto Peg R (Right). |
| 2 | Move Disk B from Disk C | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Peg M (Middle). |
| 3 | Move Disk A from Peg R | Move Disk A from Peg R onto Disk B. |
| 4 | Move Disk C from Disk D | Move Disk C from Disk D onto Peg R (Right). |
| 5 | Move Disk A from Disk B | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk D. |
| 6 | Move Disk B from Peg M | Move Disk B from Peg M onto Disk C. |
| 7 | Move Disk A from Disk D | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |

| 9 | Move Disk B from Disk C | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk D. |
| 10 | Move Disk A from Peg M | Move Disk A from Peg M onto Disk B. |
| 11 | Move Disk C from Peg R | Move Disk C from Peg R onto Peg M (Middle). |

| 14 | Move Disk A from Peg R | Move Disk A from Peg R onto Disk B. |
| 15 | Move Disk D from Disk E | Move Disk D from Disk E onto Peg R (Right). |
| 16 | Move Disk A from Disk B | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk E. |
| 17 | Move Disk A from Disk E | Move Disk A from Disk E onto Disk D. |
| 18 | Move Disk B from Disk C | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk E. |
| 19 | Move Disk A from Disk D | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 20 | Move Disk C from Peg M | Move Disk C from Peg M onto Disk D. |

================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the left peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the left peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi)\n  (:requirements :strips :typing :action-costs)\n  (:types \n    disk - object\n    peg - object\n  )\n  (:predicates\n    (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 immediately on d2\n    (base-on ?d - disk ?p - peg) ; d is the base disk on peg p\n    (clear ?d - disk) ; d is the top disk of a stack\n    (peg-empty ?p - peg) ; peg p has no disks\n    \n    (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 < d2 (Static size relationship)\n  )\n  (:functions\n    (total-cost)\n  )\n\n  ; A1. Move D (on D_S) to D_T (Disk target)\n  (:action move-disk-to-disk\n    :parameters (?d - disk ?d_s - disk ?d_t - disk)\n    :precondition (and \n      (clear ?d)\n      (on ?d ?d_s)\n      (clear ?d_t)\n      (smaller ?d ?d_t) ; Rule: Cannot place larger disk on smaller disk\n    )\n    :effect (and \n      (not (on ?d ?d_s))\n      (on ?d ?d_t)\n      (clear ?d_s)\n      (not (clear ?d_t))\n      (increase (total-cost) 1)\n    )\n  )\n\n  ; A2.     "pddl_problem": "(define (problem Hanoi-5-Disks)\n  (:domain hanoi)\n  (:objects\n    A B C D E - disk ; A smallest, E largest\n    L M R - peg    ; Left, Middle, Right\n  )\n  (:init\n    ; Static Size relations: A < B < C < D < E\n    (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n    (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n    (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n    (smaller D E)\n    \n    ; Initial state: Stack (A B C D E) top to bottom on R\n    (on A B)\n    (on B C)\n    (on C D)\n    (on D E)\n    \n    (base-on E R)\n    \n    ; Clear status\n    (clear A)\n    ; B, C, D, E are not clear\n    \n    ; Peg status\n    (peg-empty L)\n    (peg-empty M)\n    ; R is not empty\n    \n    (= (total-cost) 0)\n  )\n  (:goal\n    (and\n      ; Target stack on L: (A B C D E)\n      (on A B)\n      (on B C)\n      (on C D)\n      (on D E)\n      (base-on E L)\n      \n      ; R and M must be empty\n      (peg-empty R)\n      (peg-empty M)\n    )\n  )\n  (:metric minimize (total-cost))",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_3
------------------------------
This plan details the steps required to move a stack of five disks (A, B, C, D, E, where A is the smallest and E is the largest) from the Right peg (R) to the Left peg (L), following the rules of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle (a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller one).

### Hanoi Plan Execution (5 Disks: R $\rightarrow$ L)

| Step | Action | Details |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (smallest) from Disk B to the Middle peg (M). |
| 2 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk C to the Left peg (L). |
| 3 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (base on M) onto Disk B. |
| 4 | **Move Disk C** | Move Disk C from Disk D to the Middle peg (M). |
| 5 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk D. |
| 6 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B (base on L) onto Disk C. |
| 7 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 8 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Left peg (L). |
| 9 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk D. |
| 10 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (base on L) onto Disk B. |
| 11 | **Move Disk C** | Move Disk C (base on M) to the Left peg (L). |
| 12 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Middle peg (M). |
| 13 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk D onto Disk C. |
| 14 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (base on M) onto Disk B. |
| 15 | **Move Disk D** | Move Disk D from Disk E to the Middle peg (M). |
| 16 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk E. |
| 17 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk E onto Disk D. |
| 18 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk E. |
| 19 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 20 | **Move Disk C** | Move Disk C (base on L) onto Disk D. |
| 21 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Left peg (L). |
| 22 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk E onto Disk C. |
| 23 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (base on L) onto Disk B. |
| 24 | **Move Disk E** | Move Disk E (base on R) to the Left peg (L). |
| 25 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Right peg (R). |
| 26 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk E. |
| 27 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (base on R) onto Disk B. |
| 28 | **Move Disk C** | Move Disk C from Disk D to the Right peg (R). |
| 29 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk D. |
| 30 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk E onto Disk C. |
| 31 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 32 | **Move Disk D** | Move Disk D (base on M) onto Disk E. |
| 33 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Middle peg (M). |
| 34 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (base on M) onto Disk D. |
| 35 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B from Disk C to the Middle peg (M). |
| 36 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 37 | **Move Disk C** | Move Disk C (base on R) onto Disk D. |
| 38 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Right peg (R). |
| 39 | **Move Disk B** | Move Disk B (base on M) onto Disk C. |
| 40 | **Move Disk A** | Move Disk A (base on R) onto Disk B. |

***The final configuration has the stack (A, B, C, D, E) correctly positioned on the Left peg (L).***
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]

As initial conditions I have that, the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the left peg and the middle peg are empty again.

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)   ; d1 is immediately on d2\n        (on-peg ?d - disk ?p - peg)  ; d is the base disk resting on peg p\n        (clear ?d - disk)            ; d has nothing on it (is the top disk)\n        (empty ?p - peg)             ; p has no disks on it\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2 (A < B < C < D < E)\n    )\n\n    ;; Action 1: Move disk D from D_from to D_to (Disk -> Disk)\n    ;; Moves a non-base disk onto an existing stack head.\n    (:action move-disk-on-disk-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_from - disk ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?d_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_from))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            (clear ?d_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action 2: Move disk D from D_from to Peg P_to (Disk -> Empty Peg)\n    ;; Moves a non-base disk onto a newly empty peg.\n    (:action move-disk-on-disk-to-empty-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_from - disk ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?d_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (empty ?p_to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_from))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_to)\n            (clear ?d_from)\n            (not (empty ?p_to))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action 3: Move disk D from Peg P_from to D_to (Base Disk -> Disk)\n    ;; Moves the base disk of a stack onto an existing stack head.\n    (:action move-base-disk-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to)\n            (not (empty ?p_from)) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            (empty ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action 4: Move disk D from Peg P_from to Peg P_to (Base Disk -> Empty Peg)\n    ;; Moves the base disk of a stack to an empty peg.\n    (:action move-base-disk-to-empty-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (empty ?p_to)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n            (not (empty ?p_from))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_to)\n            (empty ?p_from)\n            (not (empty ?p_to))\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-left-to-right)\n    (:domain hanoi-5disks)\n    (:objects\n        a b c d e - disk\n        left middle right - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ;; Size relations: A < B < C < D < E\n        (smaller a b) (smaller a c) (smaller a d) (smaller a e)\n        (smaller b c) (smaller b d) (smaller b e)\n        (smaller c d) (smaller c e)\n        (smaller d e)\n\n        ;; Initial state: Stack A/B/C/D/E on LEFT peg\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on-peg e left)\n\n        (clear a)\n        (empty middle)\n        (empty right)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ;; Final stack A/B/C/D/E on RIGHT peg\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on-peg e right)\n        (clear a)\n        \n        ;; Left and Middle pegs must be empty\n        (empty left)\n        (empty middle)\n    ))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

This is the sequence of human-readable instructions required to solve the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, moving all disks (A, B, C, D, E) from the Left Peg to the Right Peg, following the provided PDDL plan exactly.

**Goal achieved:** All five disks (A, B, C, D, E) are stacked correctly on the Right Peg.
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

                        "pddl_hanoi_solver"

Does the PDDL domain correctly define preconditions for the 'move' action to ensure only the top disk is moved?\n3. If the PDDL is sound and complete for the specified problem, confirm it. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.\nThe left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types disk peg - location)\n    \n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?l - location) ; d is supported by l (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?l - location)       ; l has nothing on it\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is strictly smaller than d2 (Static)\n    )\n    \n    (:functions ((total-cost)) - number)\n    \n    ; Action 1: Move disk D from F onto empty peg P\n    (:action move-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - location ?p - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            ; 1. Must be the top disk\n            (on ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; 2. Target peg must be empty (clear)\n            (clear ?p)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?from))\n            (on ?d ?p)\n            \n            ; Update clearance status\n            (not (clear ?p))\n            (clear ?from)\n            \n            ; Cost\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ; Action 2: Move disk D from F onto disk D2\n    (:action move-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - location ?d2 - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            ; 1. Must be the top disk\n            (on ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; 2. Target disk D2 must be clear\n            (clear ?d2)\n            \n            ; 3. Size constraint: D must be smaller than D2\n            (smaller ?d ?d2)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?from))\n            (on ?d ?d2)\n            \n            ; Update clearance status\n            (not (clear ?d2))\n            (clear ?from)\n            \n            ; Cost\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disks-M_to_R)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk ; A smallest, E largest\n        L M R - peg      ; Left, Middle, Right\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; Size ordering: A < B < C < D < E\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; Initial stack: Middle holds E, D, C, B, A (bottom to top)\n        (on E M)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n        \n        ; Initial clearance status\n        (clear A) ; A is on top\n        (clear L) ; Left peg is empty\n        (clear R) ; Right peg is empty\n        ; B, C, D, E are covered. M is covered by E.\n        \n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Final stack: Right holds E, D, C, B, A\n        (on E R)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n        \n        ; L and M must be empty\n        (clear L)\n        (clear M)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_2
------------------------------
This plan details the steps required to move all five disks (A, B, C, D, E, where A is the smallest and E is the largest) from the initial Middle peg (M) to the final Right peg (R), adhering strictly to the rules of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle.

**Initial State:** All five disks (E, D, C, B, A) are stacked on the **Middle (M)** peg.

| Step | Action Description |
| :--- | :--- |
| 1 | Move Disk A from Disk B to the **Left (L)** peg. |
| 2 | Move Disk B from Disk C to the **Right (R)** peg. |
| 3 | Move Disk A from the Left peg (L) onto Disk B. |
| 4 | Move Disk C from Disk D to the **Left (L)** peg. |
| 5 | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk D. |
| 6 | Move Disk B from the Right peg (R) onto Disk C. |
| 7 | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 8 | Move Disk A from Disk B to the **Right (R)** peg. |
| 9 | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk D. |
| 10 | Move Disk A from the Right peg (R) onto Disk B. |
| 11 | Move Disk C from the Left peg (L) to the **Right (R)** peg. |
| 12 | Move Disk A from Disk B to the **Left (L)** peg. |
| 13 | Move Disk B from Disk D onto Disk C. |
| 14 | Move Disk A from the Left peg (L) onto Disk B. |
| 15 | Move Disk D from Disk E to the **Left (L)** peg. |
| 16 | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk E. |
| 17 | Move Disk A from Disk E onto Disk D. |
| 18 | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk E. |
| 19 | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 20 | Move Disk C from the Right peg (R) onto Disk D. |
| 21 | Move Disk A from Disk B to the **Right (R)** peg. |
| 22 | Move Disk B from Disk E onto Disk C. |
| 23 | Move Disk A from the Right peg (R) onto Disk B. |
| 24 | Move Disk E from the Middle peg (M) to the **Right (R)** peg. |
| 25 | Move Disk A from Disk B to the **Middle (M)** peg. |
| 26 | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk E. |
| 27 | Move Disk A from the Middle peg (M) onto Disk B. |
| 28 | Move Disk C from Disk D to the **Middle (M)** peg. |
| 29 | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk D. |
| 30 | Move Disk B from Disk E onto Disk C. |
| 31 | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 32 | Move Disk D from the Left peg (L) onto Disk E. |
| 33 | Move Disk A from Disk B to the **Left (L)** peg. |
| 34 | Move Disk A from the Left peg (L) onto Disk D. |
| 35 | Move Disk B from Disk C to the **Left (L)** peg. |
| 36 | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 37 | Move Disk C from the Middle peg (M) onto Disk D. |
| 38 | Move Disk A from Disk B to the **Middle (M)** peg. |
| 39 | Move Disk B from the Left peg (L) onto Disk C. |
| 40 | Move Disk A from the Middle peg (M) onto Disk B. |

**Final State:** All disks (E, D, C, B, A) are stacked on the Right peg (R).
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

                    "prompt": "Your name is planner. You are generating a plan for the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Review the following public information:\n{environment->public_information}\nThis is your goal:\n{agents->planner->goal}\nDefine the disk sizes (A is smallest, E is largest) and the necessary predicates to enforce the rule: a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.                 }
            },
            "auditor": {
                "review_pddl": {
                    "input": [
                        "pddl_initial_plan"
                    ],
                    "output": "pddl_audited_feedback",
                    "system_prompt": "You are a causal consistency auditor. You must remove any elements that rely on external bookkeeping or shortcuts.",
                    "prompt": "Your name is auditor. You need to review the PDDL generated by the planner against the strict rules of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. The crucial rule is: a larger disk can never be placed on a smaller disk.\nHere is the initial PDDL plan:\n{pddl_initial_plan}\nAnalyze the domain's predicates and the 'move' action definition. Do they correctly model disk size constraints (A < B < C < D < E)? Wrap your assessment in <audit_report></audit_report> tags."
                }
            },
            "orchestrator": {
                "finalize_pddl": {
                    "input": [
                        "pddl_initial_plan",
                        "pddl_audited_feedback"
                    ],
                    "output": "pddl_final_output",
                    "system_prompt": "You are an expert PDDL integrator and orchestrator. You finalize PDDL files for execution, ensuring they are syntactically correct and incorporate any necessary revisions based on feedback. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file ready for the FastDownwards solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.",
                    "prompt": "You are the orchestrator. You have received the initial PDDL plan and an audit report. Your task is to produce the definitive PDDL files to solve the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle.\nInitial PDDL Plan:\n{pddl_initial_plan}\nAudit Report:\n{pddl_audited_feedback}\nReview the audit feedback. If corrections are suggested regarding the size hierarchy constraints, implement them in the final PDDL. If the plan is confirmed valid, present the original PDDL unchanged as the final output.\nThink step by step and provide the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file.\nEnclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags."
                }
            },
            "constraints": [
                "planner.generate_pddl->auditor.review_pddl",
                "planner.generate_pddl->orchestrator.finalize_pddl",
                "auditor.review_pddl->orchestrator.finalize_pddl"
            ]
        }
    },
    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5disk)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        disk\n        peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is immediately on top of d2\n        (on-peg ?d - disk ?p - peg) ; d is immediately on top of peg p\n        (clear ?x) ; x is a disk or peg, with nothing on top\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 size < d2 size\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost) - number\n    )\n\n    ; 1. Move disk D from disk D1 to disk D2\n    (:action move-dd\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?d1)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?d2)\n            (smaller ?d ?d2) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than D2\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d1))\n            (on ?d ?d2)\n            (clear ?d1)\n            (not (clear ?d2))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 2. Move disk D from disk D1 to peg P2\n    (:action move-dp\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d1 - disk ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?d1)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p2) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d1))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p2)\n            (clear ?d1)\n            (not (clear ?p2))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 3. Move disk D from peg P1 to disk D2\n    (:action move-pd\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?d2 - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on-peg ?d ?p1)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?d2)\n            (smaller ?d ?d2) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than D2\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p1))\n            (on ?d ?d2)\n            (clear ?p1)\n            (not (clear ?d2))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 4. Move disk D from peg P1 to peg P2\n    (:action move-pp\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on-peg ?d ?p1)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p2)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p1))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p2)\n            (clear ?p1)\n            (not (clear ?p2))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5disk-m-to-r)\n    (:domain hanoi-5disk)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; Size constraints: A (smallest) < B < C < D < E (largest)\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ; Initial stack configuration on M (E bottom, A top)\n        (on-peg E M)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n\n        ; Clearance states\n        (clear A) ; Top disk A is clear\n        (clear L) ; Left peg L is clear\n        (clear R) ; Right peg R is clear\n\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Final stack configuration on R (E bottom, A top)\n        (on-peg E R)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n\n        ; L and M must be clear (empty)\n        (clear L)\n        (clear M)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_1
------------------------------
This is the sequence of human-readable instructions derived from the PDDL plan to solve the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, moving the stack from the Middle peg (M) to the Right peg (R).

The disks are ordered by size: A (smallest) < B < C < D < E (largest).

| Step | Time | Action |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | T=1 | Move disk **A** from disk B to peg L (Left). |
| 2 | T=2 | Move disk **B** from disk C to peg R (Right). |
| 3 | T=3 | Move disk **A** from peg L to disk B. |
| 4 | T=4 | Move disk **C** from disk D to peg L (Left). |
| 5 | T=5 | Move disk **A** from disk B to disk D. |
| 6 | T=6 | Move disk **B** from peg R to disk C. |
| 7 | T=7 | Move disk **A** from disk D to disk B. |
| 8 | T=8 | Move disk **A** from disk B to peg R (Right). |
| 9 | T=9 | Move disk **B** from disk C to disk D. |
| 10 | T=10 | Move disk **A** from peg R to disk B. |
| 11 | T=11 | Move disk **C** from peg L to peg R (Right). |
| 12 | T=12 | Move disk **A** from disk B to peg L (Left). |
| 13 | T=13 | Move disk **B** from disk D to disk C. |
| 14 | T=14 | Move disk **A** from peg L to disk B. |
| 15 | T=15 | Move disk **D** from disk E to peg L (Left). |
| 16 | T=16 | Move disk **A** from disk B to disk E. |
| 17 | T=17 | Move disk **A** from disk E to disk D. |
| 18 | T=18 | Move disk **B** from disk C to disk E. |
| 19 | T=19 | Move disk **A** from disk D to disk B. |
| 20 | T=20 | Move disk **C** from peg R to disk D. |
| 21 | T=21 | Move disk **A** from disk B to peg R (Right). |
| 22 | T=22 | Move disk **B** from disk E to disk C. |
| 23 | T=23 | Move disk **A** from peg R to disk B. |
| 24 | T=24 | Move disk **E** from peg M to peg R (Right). |
| 25 | T=25 | Move disk **A** from disk B to peg M (Middle). |
| 26 | T=26 | Move disk **B** from disk C to disk E. |
| 27 | T=27 | Move disk **A** from peg M to disk B. |
| 28 | T=28 | Move disk **C** from disk D to peg M (Middle). |
| 29 | T=29 | Move disk **A** from disk B to disk D. |
| 30 | T=30 | Move disk **B** from disk E to disk C. |
| 31 | T=31 | Move disk **A** from disk D to disk B. |
| 32 | T=32 | Move disk **D** from peg L to disk E. |

| 34 | T=34 | Move disk **A** from peg L to disk D. |
| 35 | T=35 | Move disk **B** from disk C to peg L (Left). |

| 37 | T=37 | Move disk **C** from peg M to disk D. |

| 39 | T=39 | Move disk **B** from peg L to disk C. |
| 40 | T=40 | Move disk **A** from peg M to disk B. |
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================


ENVIRONMENT
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:
