    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5disk)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        ; Disk arrangement\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)  ; d1 is immediately on d2\n        (on-base ?d - disk ?p - peg) ; d is immediately on the peg base p\n        \n        ; Availability for movement/placement\n        (clear ?d - disk) ; d has nothing on top of it\n        (clear-peg ?p - peg) ; Peg p is entirely empty (base is available)\n        \n        ; Size constraints (static)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2\n    )\n\n    ;; 1. Move D from source support Ds (disk) to target support Dt (disk)\n    (:action move_D_from_Ds_to_Dt\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?ds - disk ?dt - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?dt) ; Target disk must be the top of its stack\n\n            ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than Dt\n            (smaller ?d ?dt)\n\n            ; Source attachment (D on Ds)\n            (on ?d ?ds)\n            \n            ; Note: Peg location is implicitly tracked by the chain of 'on'/'on-base' predicates.\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on ?d ?ds))\n            (on ?d ?dt)\n\n            ; Source support Ds becomes clear\n            (clear ?ds)\n            \n            ; Target support Dt is no longer clear\n            (not (clear ?dt))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; 2. Move D from source support Ds (disk) to target peg P2 base (empty stack)\n    (:action move_D_from_Ds_to_P2_base\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?ds - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target must be an empty peg\n            (clear-peg ?p2) \n            \n            ; Source attachment (D on Ds)\n            (on ?d ?ds)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on ?d ?ds))\n            (on-base ?d ?p2)\n            \n            ; Source support Ds becomes clear\n            (clear ?ds)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 is no longer empty\n            (not (clear-peg ?p2))\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; 3. Move D from source peg P1 base to target disk Dt (disk)\n    (:action move_D_from_P1_base_to_Dt\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?dt - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target disk Dt must be clear\n            (clear ?dt) \n            \n            ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than Dt\n            (smaller ?d ?dt)\n\n            ; Source attachment (D on P1 base)\n            (on-base ?d ?p1)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p1))\n            (on ?d ?dt)\n            \n            ; P1 base becomes clear / empty\n            (clear-peg ?p1)\n            \n            ; Target disk Dt is no longer clear\n            (not (clear ?dt))\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; 4. Move D from source peg P1 base to target peg P2 base (empty stack)\n    (:action move_D_from_P1_base_to_P2_base\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 must be empty\n            (clear-peg ?p2) \n            \n            ; Source attachment (D on P1 base)\n            (on-base ?d ?p1)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p1))\n            (on-base ?d ?p2)\n            \n            ; P1 base becomes clear / empty\n            (clear-peg ?p1)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 is no longer empty\n            (not (clear-peg ?p2))\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5disk-M_to_R)\n    (:domain hanoi-5disk)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Ordering: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; --- Initial State: M stack (E bottom, A top) ---\n        \n        ; Stack structure\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E M)\n        \n        ; Clear status\n        (clear A)\n        (not (clear B)) \n        (not (clear C)) \n        (not (clear D)) \n        (not (clear E)) \n        \n        ; Peg status\n        (clear-peg L)\n        (not (clear-peg M))\n        (clear-peg R)\n    )\n    (:goal\n        (and\n            ; Goal stack: A on B on C on D on E, E on R base.\n            (on A B)\n            (on B C)\n            (on C D)\n            (on D E)\n            (on-base E R)\n            \n            ; Pegs L and M must be empty\n            (clear-peg L)\n            (clear-peg M)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

Here is the action I can do\n\nMove the top disk from one peg to another peg\n\nI must obey the following rules:\nI can move only one disk at a time.\nI may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.\nI can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.\nOnce a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.\n\n[STATEMENT]\nThere are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.\nThe left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5disk)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        ; Disk arrangement\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)  ; d1 is immediately on d2\n        (on-base ?d - disk ?p - peg) ; d is immediately on the peg base p\n        \n        ; Availability for movement/placement\n        (clear ?d - disk) ; d has nothing on top of it\n        (clear-peg ?p - peg) ; Peg p is entirely empty (base is available)\n        \n        ; Size constraints (static)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2\n    )\n\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost) - number\n    )\n\n    ;; 1. Move D from source support Ds (disk) to target support Dt (disk)\n    (:action move_D_from_Ds_to_Dt\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?ds - disk ?dt - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?dt) ; Target disk must be the top of its stack\n\n            ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than Dt\n            (smaller ?d ?dt)\n\n            ; Source attachment (D on Ds)\n            (on ?d ?ds)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on ?d ?ds))\n            (on ?d ?dt)\n\n            ; Source support Ds becomes clear\n            (clear ?ds)\n            \n            ; Target support Dt is no longer clear\n            (not (clear ?dt))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; 2. Move D from source support Ds (disk) to target peg P2 base (empty stack)\n    (:action move_D_from_Ds_to_P2_base\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?ds - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target must be an empty peg\n            (clear-peg ?p2) \n            \n            ; Source attachment (D on Ds)\n            (on ?d ?ds)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on ?d ?ds))\n            (on-base ?d ?p2)\n            \n            ; Source support Ds becomes clear\n            (clear ?ds)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 is no longer empty\n            (not (clear-peg ?p2))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; 3. Move D from source peg P1 base to target disk Dt (disk)\n    (:action move_D_from_P1_base_to_Dt\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?dt - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target disk Dt must be clear\n            (clear ?dt) \n            \n            ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than Dt\n            (smaller ?d ?dt)\n\n            ; Source attachment (D on P1 base)\n            (on-base ?d ?p1)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p1))\n            (on ?d ?dt)\n            \n            ; P1 base becomes clear / empty\n            (clear-peg ?p1)\n            \n            ; Target disk Dt is no longer clear\n            (not (clear ?dt))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; 4. Move D from source peg P1 base to target peg P2 base (empty stack)\n    (:action move_D_from_P1_base_to_P2_base\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 must be empty\n            (clear-peg ?p2) \n            \n            ; Source attachment (D on P1 base)\n            (on-base ?d ?p1)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p1))\n            (on-base ?d ?p2)\n            \n            ; P1 base becomes clear / empty\n            (clear-peg ?p1)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 is no longer empty\n            (not (clear-peg ?p2))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5disk-M_to_R)\n    (:domain hanoi-5disk)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Ordering: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; --- Initial State: M stack (E bottom, A top) ---\n        \n        ; Stack structure\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E M)\n        \n        ; Clear status (Only positive facts listed, relying on CWA)\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; Peg status (Only positive facts listed, relying on CWA)\n        (clear-peg L)\n        (clear-peg R)\n        \n        ; Initial cost\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal\n        (and\n            ; Goal stack: A on B on C on D on E, E on R base.\n            (on A B)\n            (on B C)\n            (on C D)\n            (on D E)\n            (on-base E R)\n            \n            ; Pegs L and M must be empty\n            (clear-peg L)\n            (clear-peg M)\n        )\n    )\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",
    "pddl_plan": "No plan found.",

Move D from source support Ds (disk) to target peg P2 base (empty stack)\n    (:action move_D_from_Ds_to_P2_base\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?ds - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target must be an empty peg\n            (clear-peg ?p2) \n            \n            ; Source attachment (D on Ds)\n            (on ?d ?ds)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on ?d ?ds))\n            (on-base ?d ?p2)\n            \n            ; Source support Ds becomes clear\n            (clear ?ds)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 is no longer empty\n            (not (clear-peg ?p2))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; 3. Move D from source peg P1 base to target disk Dt (disk)\n    (:action move_D_from_P1_base_to_Dt\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg ?dt - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target disk Dt must be clear\n            (clear ?dt) \n            \n            ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than Dt\n            (smaller ?d ?dt)\n\n            ; Source attachment (D on P1 base)\n            (on-base ?d ?p1)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p1))\n            (on ?d ?dt)\n            \n            ; P1 base becomes clear / empty\n            (clear-peg ?p1)\n            \n            ; Target disk Dt is no longer clear\n            (not (clear ?dt))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; 4. Move D from source peg P1 base to target peg P2 base (empty stack)\n    (:action move_D_from_P1_base_to_P2_base\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 must be empty\n            (clear-peg ?p2) \n            \n            ; Source attachment (D on P1 base)\n            (on-base ?d ?p1)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Move D\n            (not (on-base ?d ?p1))\n            (on-base ?d ?p2)\n            \n            ; P1 base becomes clear / empty\n            (clear-peg ?p1)\n            \n            ; Target peg P2 is no longer empty\n            (not (clear-peg ?p2))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5disk-M_to_R)\n    (:domain hanoi-5disk)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Ordering: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; --- Initial State: M stack (E bottom, A top) ---\n        \n        ; Stack structure\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E M)\n        \n        ; Clear status (Only positive facts listed, relying on CWA)\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; Peg status (Only positive facts listed, relying on CWA)\n        (clear-peg L)\n        (clear-peg R)\n        \n        ; Initial cost\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal\n        (and\n            ; Goal stack: A on B on C on D on E, E on R base.\n            (on A B)\n            (on B C)\n            (on C D)\n            (on D E)\n            (on-base E R)\n            \n            ; Pegs L and M must be empty\n            (clear-peg L)\n            (clear-peg M)\n        )\n    )\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",

================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================


ENVIRONMENT
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        ; Connectivity & State\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)          ; d1 is directly on d2\n        (on-peg ?d - disk ?p - peg)         ; d is directly on peg p base\n        (clear ?x - (either disk peg))      ; nothing is on x\n        \n        ; Static Size Ordering (d1 must be smaller than d2)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)\n    )\n\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost) ; Metric tracking\n    )\n\n    ; --- 1. Move Disk from Disk (D_FROM) to Disk (D_TO) ---\n    (:action move-d-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_from - disk ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_from)\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to) ; Rule 3: Size constraint\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_from))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            \n            (clear ?d_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; --- 2. Move Disk from Disk (D_FROM) to Peg base (P_TO) ---\n    (:action move-d-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_from - disk ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_from)\n            (clear ?p_to) ; Peg base is clear\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_from))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_to)\n            \n            (clear ?d_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; --- 3. Move Disk from Peg base (P_FROM) to Disk (D_TO) ---\n    (:action move-p-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to) ; Rule 3: Size constraint\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            \n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; --- 4. Move Disk from Peg base (P_FROM) to Peg base (P_TO) ---\n    (:action move-p-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?p_to)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to)) ; Ensure pegs are different\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_to)\n            \n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-m-to-r)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk ; A is smallest, E is largest\n        L M R - peg      ; Left, Middle, Right\n    )\n    (:init\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n        \n        ; Static Size Ordering\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ; Initial State: [A, B, C, D, E] on Middle (M).\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-peg E M)\n        \n        ; Initial Clearance\n        (clear A)\n        (clear L)\n        (clear R)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Goal State: [A, B, C, D, E] on Right (R).\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-peg E R)\n        \n        ; Other pegs must be empty\n        (clear L)\n        (clear M)\n        \n        ; Top disk must be clear\n        (clear A)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",

Here is the action I can do\n\nMove the top disk from one peg to another peg\n\nI must obey the following rules:\nI can move only one disk at a time.\nI may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.\nI can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.\nOnce a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.\n\n[STATEMENT]\nThere are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.\nThe left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        ; Connectivity & State\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)          ; d1 is directly on d2\n        (on-peg ?d - disk ?p - peg)         ; d is directly on peg p base\n        (clear ?x - (either disk peg))      ; nothing is on x\n        \n        ; Static Size Ordering (d1 must be smaller than d2)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)\n    )\n\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost) ; Metric tracking\n    )\n\n    ; --- 1. Move Disk from Disk (D_FROM) to Disk (D_TO) ---\n    (:action move-d-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_from - disk ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_from)\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to) ; Rule 3: Size constraint\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_from))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            \n            (clear ?d_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; --- 2. Move Disk from Peg base (P_FROM) to Disk (D_TO) ---\n    (:action move-p-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to) ; Rule 3: Size constraint\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            \n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; --- 4. Move Disk from Peg base (P_FROM) to Peg base (P_TO) ---\n    (:action move-p-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?p_to)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to)) ; Ensure pegs are different\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_to)\n            \n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            \n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-m-to-r)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk ; A is smallest, E is largest\n        L M R - peg      ; Left, Middle, Right\n    )\n    (:init\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n        \n        ; Static Size Ordering\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ; Initial State: [A, B, C, D, E] on Middle (M).\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-peg E M)\n        \n        ; Initial Clearance (A is top, L and R are empty)\n        (clear A)\n        (clear L)\n        (clear R)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Goal State: [A, B, C, D, E] on Right (R).\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-peg E R)\n        \n        ; Other pegs must be empty\n        (clear L)\n        (clear M)\n        \n        ; Top disk must be clear\n        (clear A)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_2
------------------------------
The following sequence of 40 instructions details the movement of the 5 disks (A being the smallest, E the largest) to transfer the entire stack from the Middle peg (M) to the Right peg (R), strictly following the rules of the Tower of Hanoi.

| Step | Action | Description |
| :---: | :--- | :--- |
| **1** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B to the **Left (L) peg base.** |
| **2** | **Move Disk B** from Disk C to the **Right (R) peg base.** |
| **3** | **Move Disk A** from the Left (L) peg base onto **Disk B.** |
| **4** | **Move Disk C** from Disk D to the **Left (L) peg base.** |
| **5** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B onto **Disk D.** |
| **6** | **Move Disk B** from the Right (R) peg base onto **Disk C.** |
| **7** | **Move Disk A** from Disk D onto **Disk B.** |
| **8** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B to the **Right (R) peg base.** |
| **9** | **Move Disk B** from Disk C onto **Disk D.** |
| **10** | **Move Disk A** from the Right (R) peg base onto **Disk B.** |
| **11** | **Move Disk C** from the Left (L) peg base to the **Right (R) peg base.** |
| **12** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B to the **Left (L) peg base.** |
| **13** | **Move Disk B** from Disk D onto **Disk C.** |
| **14** | **Move Disk A** from the Left (L) peg base onto **Disk B.** |
| **15** | **Move Disk D** from Disk E to the **Left (L) peg base.** |
| **16** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B onto **Disk E.** |
| **17** | **Move Disk A** from Disk E onto **Disk D.** |
| **18** | **Move Disk B** from Disk C onto **Disk E.** |
| **19** | **Move Disk A** from Disk D onto **Disk B.** |
| **20** | **Move Disk C** from the Right (R) peg base onto **Disk D.** |
| **21** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B to the **Right (R) peg base.** |
| **22** | **Move Disk B** from Disk E onto **Disk C.** |
| **23** | **Move Disk A** from the Right (R) peg base onto **Disk B.** |
| **24** | **Move Disk E** from the Middle (M) peg base to the **Right (R) peg base.** |
| **25** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B to the **Middle (M) peg base.** |
| **26** | **Move Disk B** from Disk C onto **Disk E.** |
| **27** | **Move Disk A** from the Middle (M) peg base onto **Disk B.** |
| **28** | **Move Disk C** from Disk D to the **Middle (M) peg base.** |
| **29** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B onto **Disk D.** |
| **30** | **Move Disk B** from Disk E onto **Disk C.** |
| **31** | **Move Disk A** from Disk D onto **Disk B.** |
| **32** | **Move Disk D** from the Left (L) peg base onto **Disk E.** |
| **33** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B to the **Left (L) peg base.** |
| **34** | **Move Disk A** from the Left (L) peg base onto **Disk D.** |
| **35** | **Move Disk B** from Disk C to the **Left (L) peg base.** |
| **36** | **Move Disk A** from Disk D onto **Disk B.** |
| **37** | **Move Disk C** from the Middle (M) peg base onto **Disk D.** |
| **38** | **Move Disk A** from Disk B to the **Middle (M) peg base.** |
| **39** | **Move Disk B** from the Left (L) peg base onto **Disk C.** |
| **40** | **Move Disk A** from the Middle (M) peg base onto **Disk B.** |

The operation is complete. All disks [A, B, C, D, E] are stacked on the Right (R) peg. (Total Cost: 40 moves)
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disk)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is immediately on d2\n        (at ?d - disk ?p - peg) ; Disk d is the bottom disk resting on peg p\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 < d2 (static size property)\n        (clear ?d - disk) ; d has nothing on top of it\n        (empty ?p - peg)  ; p has no disks on it\n    )\n    \n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ;; 1. Move D from a Disk (D_below) onto a Disk (D_target)\n    (:action move-disk-disk-to-disk-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_below - disk ?d_target - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?d_below)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?d_target)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_target)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below))\n            (not (clear ?d_target))\n            (on ?d ?d_target)\n            (clear ?d_below)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; 2. Move D from a Peg (P1) onto a Disk (D_target)\n    (:action move-disk-peg-to-disk-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?d_target - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (at ?d ?p1)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?d_target)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_target)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (at ?d ?p1))\n            (not (clear ?d_target))\n            (on ?d ?d_target)\n            (empty ?p1)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; 3. Move D from a Disk (D_below) onto a Peg (P2)\n    (:action move-disk-disk-to-disk-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_below - disk ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?d_below)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (empty ?p2)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below))\n            (not (empty ?p2))\n            (at ?d ?p2)\n            (clear ?d_below)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; 4. Move D from a Peg (P1) onto a Peg (P2)\n    (:action move-disk-peg-to-disk-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p1 - peg ?p2 - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (at ?d ?p1)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (empty ?p2)\n            (not (= ?p1 ?p2))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (at ?d ?p1))\n            (not (empty ?p2))\n            (at ?d ?p2)\n            (empty ?p1)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-p)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disk)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        Peg1 Peg2 Peg3 - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n        \n        ; Initial Stacks on Peg2 (E=bottom, A=top)\n        (at E Peg2)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n        \n        ; Initial Clearance & Empty Pegs\n        (clear A)\n        (empty Peg1)\n        (empty Peg3)\n        \n        ; Static Size Relations (Smaller D1 D2)\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Stack is built on Peg3: E, D, C, B, A\n        (at E Peg3)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n        \n        ; Intermediate peg (Peg1) must be empty\n        (empty Peg1)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_1
------------------------------
This sequence of instructions guides the mover agent (MoverBot) through the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, moving the entire stack from Peg2 (Middle) to Peg3 (Right), using Peg1 (Left) as the auxiliary peg.

The disks are ordered A (smallest) < B < C < D < E (largest).

### Tower of Hanoi 5-Disk Solution (33 Moves)

1.  **Move 1:** Move Disk A from Peg2 onto Peg3. (Peg3 is now: A)
2.  **Move 2:** Move Disk B from Peg2 onto Peg1. (Peg1 is now: B)
3.  **Move 3:** Move Disk A from Peg3 onto Disk B (at Peg1). (Peg1 is now: B, A)
4.  **Move 4:** Move Disk C from Peg2 onto Peg3. (Peg3 is now: C)
5.  **Move 5:** Move Disk A from Disk B (at Peg1) onto Disk D (at Peg2). (Peg2 is now: D, A)
6.  **Move 6:** Move Disk B from Peg1 onto Disk C (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: C, B)
7.  **Move 7:** Move Disk A from Disk D (at Peg2) onto Disk B (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: C, B, A)
8.  **Move 8:** Move Disk D from Peg2 onto Peg1. (Peg1 is now: D)
9.  **Move 9:** Move Disk A from Disk B (at Peg3) onto Disk E (at Peg2). (Peg2 is now: E, A)
10. **Move 10:** Move Disk A from Disk E (at Peg2) onto Disk D (at Peg1). (Peg1 is now: D, A)
11. **Move 11:** Move Disk B from Disk C (at Peg3) onto Disk E (at Peg2). (Peg2 is now: E, B)
12. **Move 12:** Move Disk A from Disk D (at Peg1) onto Disk B (at Peg2). (Peg2 is now: E, B, A)
13. **Move 13:** Move Disk C from Peg3 onto Disk D (at Peg1). (Peg1 is now: D, C)
14. **Move 14:** Move Disk A from Disk B (at Peg2) onto Peg3. (Peg3 is now: A)
15. **Move 15:** Move Disk B from Disk E (at Peg2) onto Disk C (at Peg1). (Peg1 is now: D, C, B)
16. **Move 16:** Move Disk A from Peg3 onto Disk B (at Peg1). (Peg1 is now: D, C, B, A)
17. **Move 17:** Move Disk E from Peg2 onto Peg3. (Peg3 is now: E)
18. **Move 18:** Move Disk A from Disk B (at Peg1) onto Peg2. (Peg2 is now: A)
19. **Move 19:** Move Disk B from Disk C (at Peg1) onto Disk E (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: E, B)
20. **Move 20:** Move Disk A from Peg2 onto Disk B (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: E, B, A)
21. **Move 21:** Move Disk C from Disk D (at Peg1) onto Peg2. (Peg2 is now: C)
22. **Move 22:** Move Disk A from Disk B (at Peg3) onto Disk D (at Peg1). (Peg1 is now: D, A)
23. **Move 23:** Move Disk B from Disk E (at Peg3) onto Disk C (at Peg2). (Peg2 is now: C, B)
24. **Move 24:** Move Disk A from Disk D (at Peg1) onto Disk B (at Peg2). (Peg2 is now: C, B, A)
25. **Move 25:** Move Disk D from Peg1 onto Disk E (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: E, D)
26. **Move 26:** Move Disk A from Disk B (at Peg2) onto Peg1. (Peg1 is now: A)
27. **Move 27:** Move Disk A from Peg1 onto Disk D (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: E, D, A)
28. **Move 28:** Move Disk B from Disk C (at Peg2) onto Peg1. (Peg1 is now: B)
29. **Move 29:** Move Disk A from Disk D (at Peg3) onto Disk B (at Peg1). (Peg1 is now: B, A)
30. **Move 30:** Move Disk C from Peg2 onto Disk D (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: E, D, C)
31. **Move 31:** Move Disk A from Disk B (at Peg1) onto Peg2. (Peg2 is now: A)
32. **Move 32:** Move Disk B from Peg1 onto Disk C (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: E, D, C, B)
33. **Move 33:** Move Disk A from Peg2 onto Disk B (at Peg3). (Peg3 is now: E, D, C, B, A)

**Goal State Achieved:** All disks are stacked on Peg3, ordered from largest (E) to smallest (A), and Peg1 (Left) is empty. (Total moves: 33).
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the left peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the middle peg are empty again.
The middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk object\n        peg object\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2 (size hierarchy)\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)      ; d1 immediately on d2\n        (on-base ?d - disk ?p - peg)    ; d is on the base of peg p\n        (clear ?d - disk)               ; d has nothing on top (is movable)\n        (peg-empty ?p - peg)            ; Peg p has no disks\n        (at ?d - disk ?p - peg)         ; d is located at peg p\n    )\n\n    ;; Action A: Move D from Base(FROM) to Empty Peg (TO)\n    (:action move_disk_base_to_empty_peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (on-base ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (peg-empty ?to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-base ?d ?from))\n            (on-base ?d ?to)\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n            (peg-empty ?from) \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action B: Move D from D_BELOW_F to Empty Peg (TO)\n    (:action move_disk_onto_empty_peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_f - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (on ?d ?d_below_f) \n            (clear ?d)\n            (peg-empty ?to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below_f))\n            (on-base ?d ?to)\n            (clear ?d_below_f) \n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action C: Move D from D_BELOW_F onto D_BELOW_T (Disk to Disk)\n    (:action move_disk_onto_disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_f - disk ?d_below_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (at ?d_below_t ?to) \n            \n            (on ?d ?d_below_f)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            (clear ?d_below_t) \n            (smaller ?d ?d_below_t) ; Size constraint enforcement\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below_f))\n            (on ?d ?d_below_t)\n            (clear ?d_below_f) \n            (not (clear ?d_below_t)) \n            \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action D: Move D from Base(FROM) onto D_BELOW_T (Base to Disk)\n    (:action move_disk_base_onto_disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (at ?d_below_t ?to)\n            \n            (on-base ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            (clear ?d_below_t) \n            (smaller ?d ?d_below_t) ; Size constraint enforcement\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-base ?d ?from))\n            (on ?d ?d_below_t)\n            (peg-empty ?from) \n            (not (clear ?d_below_t)) \n            \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disks-P_R-to-P_L)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        P_L P_M P_R - peg ; P_L=Left (Target), P_M=Middle (Aux), P_R=Right (Source)\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Hierarchy: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; --- Initial Stack on P_R (Right Peg) ---\n        ; Stack: A (top) -> B -> C -> D -> E (bottom)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E P_R)\n        \n        ; Clear status\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; Peg status\n        (peg-empty P_L)\n        (peg-empty P_M)\n        ; P_R is NOT empty initially\n        \n        ; Location tracking (All disks start at P_R)\n        (at A P_R) (at B P_R) (at C P_R) (at D P_R) (at E P_R)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Target Stack on P_L (Left Peg)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E P_L)\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; All disks must be located at P_L\n        (at A P_L) (at B P_L) (at C P_L) (at D P_L) (at E P_L)\n        \n        ; Auxiliary (P_M) and Source (P_R) pegs must be empty\n        (peg-empty P_M)\n        (peg-empty P_R)\n    ))\n)",

    "human_specification": "I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do\n\nMove the top disk from one peg to another peg\n\nI must obey the following rules:\nI can move only one disk at a time.\nI may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.\nI can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.\nOnce a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.\n\n[STATEMENT]\nThere are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the middle peg and the left peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the middle peg are empty again.\nThe middle peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

            },

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk object\n        peg object\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2 (size hierarchy)\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)      ; d1 immediately on d2\n        (on-base ?d - disk ?p - peg)    ; d is on the base of peg p\n        (clear ?d - disk)               ; d has nothing on top (is movable)\n        (peg-empty ?p - peg)            ; Peg p has no disks\n        (at ?d - disk ?p - peg)         ; d is located at peg p\n    )\n\n    ;; Action A: Move D from Base(FROM) to Empty Peg (TO)\n    (:action move_disk_base_to_empty_peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (on-base ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (peg-empty ?to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-base ?d ?from))\n            (on-base ?d ?to)\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n            (peg-empty ?from) \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action B: Move D from D_BELOW_F to Empty Peg (TO)\n    (:action move_disk_onto_empty_peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_f - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (on ?d ?d_below_f) \n            (clear ?d)\n            (peg-empty ?to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below_f))\n            (on-base ?d ?to)\n            (clear ?d_below_f) \n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action C: Move D from D_BELOW_F onto D_BELOW_T (Disk to Disk)\n    (:action move_disk_onto_disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_f - disk ?d_below_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (at ?d_below_t ?to) \n            \n            (on ?d ?d_below_f)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            (clear ?d_below_t) \n            (smaller ?d ?d_below_t) ; Size constraint enforcement\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below_f))\n            (on ?d ?d_below_t)\n            (clear ?d_below_f) \n            (not (clear ?d_below_t)) \n            \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action D: Move D from Base(FROM) onto D_BELOW_T (Base to Disk)\n    (:action move_disk_base_onto_disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (at ?d_below_t ?to)\n            \n            (on-base ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            (clear ?d_below_t) \n            (smaller ?d ?d_below_t) ; Size constraint enforcement\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-base ?d ?from))\n            (on ?d ?d_below_t)\n            (peg-empty ?from) \n            (not (clear ?d_below_t)) \n            \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disks-P_R-to-P_L)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        P_L P_M P_R - peg ; P_L=Left (Target), P_M=Middle (Aux), P_R=Right (Source)\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Hierarchy: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; --- Initial Stack on P_R (Right Peg) ---\n        ; Stack: A (top) -> B -> C -> D -> E (bottom)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E P_R)\n        \n        ; Clear status\n        (clear A)\n        (clear B) ; Falsified by (on A B)\n        (clear C) ; Falsified by (on B C)\n        (clear D) ; Falsified by (on C D)\n        (clear E) ; Falsified by (on D E)\n        ; Only clear A is necessary. The others are correctly omitted.\n        \n        ; Peg status\n        (peg-empty P_L)\n        (peg-empty P_M)\n        ; P_R is NOT empty initially (implicitly, as disks are present)\n        \n        ; Location tracking (All disks start at P_R)\n        (at A P_R) (at B P_R) (at C P_R) (at D P_R) (at E P_R)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Target Stack on P_L (Left Peg)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E P_L)\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; All disks must be located at P_L\n        (at A P_L) (at B P_L) (at C P_L) (at D P_L) (at E P_L)\n        \n        ; Auxiliary (P_M) and Source (P_R) pegs must be empty\n        (peg-empty P_M)\n        (peg-empty P_R)\n    ))",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",
    "pddl_plan": "No plan found.",
    "syntax_errors": "terminate called after throwing an instance of 'parser::pddl::UnexpectedEOF'\n  what():  Unexpected EOF found\nAborted (core dumped)\n",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk object\n        peg object\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2 (size hierarchy)\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)      ; d1 immediately on d2\n        (on-base ?d - disk ?p - peg)    ; d is on the base of peg p\n        (clear ?d - disk)               ; d has nothing on top (is movable)\n        (peg-empty ?p - peg)            ; Peg p has no disks\n        (at ?d - disk ?p - peg)         ; d is located at peg p\n    )\n\n    ;; Action A: Move D from Base(FROM) to Empty Peg (TO). D must be the only disk on FROM.\n    (:action move_disk_base_to_empty_peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (on-base ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (peg-empty ?to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-base ?d ?from))\n            (on-base ?d ?to)\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n            (peg-empty ?from) \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action B: Move D from D_BELOW_F to Empty Peg (TO). D was stacked on another disk.\n    (:action move_disk_onto_empty_peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_f - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (on ?d ?d_below_f) \n            (clear ?d)\n            (peg-empty ?to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below_f))\n            (on-base ?d ?to)\n            (clear ?d_below_f) \n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action C: Move D from D_BELOW_F onto D_BELOW_T (Disk to Disk)\n    (:action move_disk_onto_disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_f - disk ?d_below_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (at ?d_below_t ?to) \n            \n            (on ?d ?d_below_f)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            (clear ?d_below_t) \n            (smaller ?d ?d_below_t) ; Size constraint enforcement\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_below_f))\n            (on ?d ?d_below_t)\n            (clear ?d_below_f) \n            (not (clear ?d_below_t)) \n            \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action D: Move D from Base(FROM) onto D_BELOW_T (Base to Disk). D must be the only disk on FROM.\n    (:action move_disk_base_onto_disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?from - peg ?to - peg ?d_below_t - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (not (= ?from ?to))\n            (at ?d ?from)\n            (at ?d_below_t ?to)\n            \n            (on-base ?d ?from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            \n            (clear ?d_below_t) \n            (smaller ?d ?d_below_t) ; Size constraint enforcement\n            (not (peg-empty ?to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-base ?d ?from))\n            (on ?d ?d_below_t)\n            (peg-empty ?from) \n            (not (clear ?d_below_t)) \n            \n            (not (at ?d ?from))\n            (at ?d ?to)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disks-P_R-to-P_L)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        P_L P_M P_R - peg ; P_L=Left (Target), P_M=Middle (Aux), P_R=Right (Source)\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size Hierarchy: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; --- Initial Stack on P_R (Right Peg) ---\n        ; Stack: A (top) -> B -> C -> D -> E (bottom)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E P_R)\n        \n        ; Clear status\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; Peg status\n        (peg-empty P_L)\n        (peg-empty P_M)\n        \n        ; Location tracking (All disks start at P_R)\n        (at A P_R) (at B P_R) (at C P_R) (at D P_R) (at E P_R)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Target Stack on P_L (Left Peg)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-base E P_L)\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; All disks must be located at P_L\n        (at A P_L) (at B P_L) (at C P_L) (at D P_L) (at E P_L)\n        \n        ; Auxiliary (P_M) and Source (P_R) pegs must be empty\n        (peg-empty P_M)\n        (peg-empty P_R)\n    ))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",
    "pddl_plan": "(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_r p_m b)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg b p_r p_l c)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_m p_l b)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg c p_r p_m d)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_r b d)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk b p_l p_m c)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_m d b)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg d p_r p_l e)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_m p_r b e)\n(move_disk_onto_disk b p_m p_l c d)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_l e b)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk c p_m p_r e)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_l p_m b)\n(move_disk_onto_disk b p_l p_r d c)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_m p_r b)\n(move_disk_base_to_empty_peg d p_l p_m)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_m b d)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg b p_r p_l c)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_m p_l d b)\n(move_disk_onto_disk c p_r p_m e d)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_r b e)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk b p_l p_m c)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_m e b)\n(move_disk_base_to_empty_peg e p_r p_l)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_m p_r b)\n(move_disk_onto_disk b p_m p_l c e)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_r p_l b)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg c p_m p_r d)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_m b d)\n(move_disk_onto_disk b p_l p_r e c)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_m p_r d b)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk d p_m p_l e)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_l b d)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg b p_r p_m c)\n(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_m d b)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk c p_r p_l d)\n(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_m p_r b)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk b p_m p_l c)\n(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_r p_l b)\n; cost = 39 (unit cost)\n",

================================================================================


NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_3
------------------------------
This plan details the 39 steps required to solve the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, moving all disks from the Right Peg (P\_R) to the Left Peg (P\_L), using the Middle Peg (P\_M) as auxiliary. (Disk A is the smallest; Disk E is the largest).

### Tower of Hanoi 5-Disk Solution (Right Peg to Left Peg)

| Step | Action | Description |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_r p_m b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg to the Middle Peg. |
| 2 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg b p_r p_l c)` | Move Disk B from the Right Peg to the Left Peg. |
| 3 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_m p_l b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg onto Disk B at the Left Peg. |
| 4 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg c p_r p_m d)` | Move Disk C from the Right Peg to the Middle Peg. |
| 5 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_r b d)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (on B) onto Disk D at the Right Peg. |
| 6 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk b p_l p_m c)` | Move Disk B from the Left Peg onto Disk C at the Middle Peg. |
| 7 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_m d b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg (on D) onto Disk B at the Middle Peg. |
| 8 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg d p_r p_l e)` | Move Disk D from the Right Peg to the Left Peg. |
| 9 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_m p_r b e)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg (on B) onto Disk E at the Right Peg. |
| 10 | `(move_disk_onto_disk b p_m p_l c d)` | Move Disk B from the Middle Peg (on C) onto Disk D at the Left Peg. |
| 11 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_l e b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg (on E) onto Disk B at the Left Peg. |
| 12 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk c p_m p_r e)` | Move Disk C from the Middle Peg onto Disk E at the Right Peg. |
| 13 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_l p_m b)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (on B) to the Middle Peg. |
| 14 | `(move_disk_onto_disk b p_l p_r d c)` | Move Disk B from the Left Peg (on D) onto Disk C at the Right Peg. |
| 15 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_m p_r b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg onto Disk B at the Right Peg. |
| 16 | `(move_disk_base_to_empty_peg d p_l p_m)` | Move Disk D from the Left Peg to the Middle Peg. |
| 17 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_m b d)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg (on B) onto Disk D at the Middle Peg. |
| 18 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg b p_r p_l c)` | Move Disk B from the Right Peg (on C) to the Left Peg. |
| 19 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_m p_l d b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg (on D) onto Disk B at the Left Peg. |
| 20 | `(move_disk_onto_disk c p_r p_m e d)` | Move Disk C from the Right Peg (on E) onto Disk D at the Middle Peg. |
| 21 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_r b e)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (on B) onto Disk E at the Right Peg. |
| 22 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk b p_l p_m c)` | Move Disk B from the Left Peg onto Disk C at the Middle Peg. |
| 23 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_m e b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg (on E) onto Disk B at the Middle Peg. |
| 24 | `(move_disk_base_to_empty_peg e p_r p_l)` | **Move Disk E (Largest) from the Right Peg to the Left Peg (Target).** |
| 25 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_m p_r b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg (on B) to the Right Peg. |
| 26 | `(move_disk_onto_disk b p_m p_l c e)` | Move Disk B from the Middle Peg (on C) onto Disk E at the Left Peg. |
| 27 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_r p_l b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg onto Disk B at the Left Peg. |
| 28 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg c p_m p_r d)` | Move Disk C from the Middle Peg (on D) to the Right Peg. |
| 29 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_m b d)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (on B) onto Disk D at the Middle Peg. |
| 30 | `(move_disk_onto_disk b p_l p_r e c)` | Move Disk B from the Left Peg (on E) onto Disk C at the Right Peg. |
| 31 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_m p_r d b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg (on D) onto Disk B at the Right Peg. |
| 32 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk d p_m p_l e)` | Move Disk D from the Middle Peg onto Disk E at the Left Peg. |
| 33 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_r p_l b d)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg (on B) onto Disk D at the Left Peg. |
| 34 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg b p_r p_m c)` | Move Disk B from the Right Peg (on C) to the Middle Peg. |
| 35 | `(move_disk_onto_disk a p_l p_m d b)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (on D) onto Disk B at the Middle Peg. |
| 36 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk c p_r p_l d)` | Move Disk C from the Right Peg onto Disk D at the Left Peg. |
| 37 | `(move_disk_onto_empty_peg a p_m p_r b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg (on B) to the Right Peg. |
| 38 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk b p_m p_l c)` | Move Disk B from the Middle Peg onto Disk C at the Left Peg. |
| 39 | `(move_disk_base_onto_disk a p_r p_l b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg onto Disk B at the Left Peg. |

**Goal achieved:** All disks are stacked smallest to largest on the Left Peg (A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E).
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the middle peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================


ENVIRONMENT
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the middle peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]

Ensure the final PDDL problem definition uses the domain name defined in the domain file. The problem should define 5 disks and 3 pegs.\nThink step by step and provide the complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task.\nEnclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags."

            "constraints": [
                "planning_agent.pddl->auditing_agent.pddl",
                "planning_agent.pddl->orchestrator.pddl",
                "auditing_agent.pddl->orchestrator.pddl"
            ]
        }
    },
    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is immediately on d2\n        (on-peg ?d - disk ?p - peg) ; d is immediately on peg p (d is the bottom disk)\n        (is-top ?d - disk) ; d has nothing on it\n        (empty ?p - peg) ; p has nothing on it\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; size ordering: d1 < d2\n    )\n\n    ;; Action 1: Move D from sitting on D_old to sitting on D_new\n    (:action move_D_D\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_old - disk ?d_new - disk)\n        :precondition (and \n            (is-top ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_old)\n            (is-top ?d_new)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_new) ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than D_new\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_old))\n            (not (is-top ?d_new))\n            (on ?d ?d_new)\n            (is-top ?d_old)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; Action 2: Move D from sitting on D_old to empty Peg P_new\n    (:action move_D_P_empty\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_old - disk ?p_new - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (is-top ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_old)\n            (empty ?p_new)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?d_old))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_new)\n            (is-top ?d_old)\n            (not (empty ?p_new))\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ;; Action 3: Move D from Peg P_old (base disk) to Disk D_new\n    (:action move_P_D\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?d_new - disk ?p_old - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (is-top ?d)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_old)\n            (is-top ?d_new)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_new) ; Size constraint\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_old))\n            (on ?d ?d_new)\n            (not (is-top ?d_new))\n            (empty ?p_old) ; P_old is now empty\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;; Action 4: Move D from Peg P_old (base disk) to empty Peg P_new\n    (:action move_P_P\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_old - peg ?p_new - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (is-top ?d)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_old)\n            (empty ?p_new)\n            (not (= ?p_old ?p_new))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_old))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_new)\n            (empty ?p_old)\n            (not (empty ?p_new))\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem BlocksworldMediumScaling13)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        R M L - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ;; Size relations: A < B < C < D < E\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        ;; Initial stack on R (Right peg): A (top) -> B -> C -> D -> E (bottom)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-peg E R)\n\n        (is-top A)\n        \n        ;; Peg status\n        (empty L)\n        (empty M)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ;; Final configuration on M (Middle peg): A->B->C->D->E\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (on-peg E M)\n        \n        ;; A must be on top\n        (is-top A) \n        \n        ;; Other pegs must be empty\n        (empty R)\n        (empty L)\n    ))\n)",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_2
------------------------------
This is a step-by-step instruction set detailing the movement of the 5 disks (A being the smallest, E the largest) to transfer the stack from the Right peg to the Middle peg, adhering strictly to the Tower of Hanoi rules.

### Initial State
All 5 disks (A, B, C, D, E) are stacked on the **Right (R)** peg. The **Middle (M)** and **Left (L)** pegs are empty.

### Instructions (40 Steps)

1.  Move Disk A (on B) to Peg Left (L).
2.  Move Disk B (on C) to Peg Middle (M).
3.  Move Disk A (from Peg L) onto Disk B (on Peg M).
4.  Move Disk C (on D) to Peg Left (L).
5.  Move Disk A (on B) onto Disk D (on Peg Right).
6.  Move Disk B (from Peg M) onto Disk C (on Peg L).
7.  Move Disk A (on D) onto Disk B (on Peg L).
8.  Move Disk A (on B) to Peg Middle (M).
9.  Move Disk B (on C) onto Disk D (on Peg Right).
10. Move Disk A (from Peg M) onto Disk B (on Peg Right).
11. Move Disk C (from Peg L) to Peg Middle (M).
12. Move Disk A (on B) to Peg Left (L).
13. Move Disk B (on D) onto Disk C (on Peg M).
14. Move Disk A (from Peg L) onto Disk B (on Peg M).
15. Move Disk D (on E) to Peg Left (L).
16. Move Disk A (on B) onto Disk E (on Peg Right).
17. Move Disk A (on E) onto Disk D (on Peg L).
18. Move Disk B (on C) onto Disk E (on Peg Right).
19. Move Disk A (on D) onto Disk B (on Peg Right).
20. Move Disk C (from Peg M) onto Disk D (on Peg L).
21. Move Disk A (on B) to Peg Middle (M).
22. Move Disk B (on E) onto Disk C (on Peg L).
23. Move Disk A (from Peg M) onto Disk B (on Peg L).
24. Move Disk E (from Peg Right) to Peg Middle (M).
25. Move Disk A (on B) to Peg Right (R).
26. Move Disk B (on C) onto Disk E (on Peg M).
27. Move Disk A (from Peg R) onto Disk B (on Peg M).
28. Move Disk C (on D) to Peg Right (R).
29. Move Disk A (on B) onto Disk D (on Peg L).
30. Move Disk B (on E) onto Disk C (on Peg R).
31. Move Disk A (on D) onto Disk B (on Peg R).
32. Move Disk D (from Peg L) onto Disk E (on Peg M).
33. Move Disk A (on B) to Peg Left (L).
34. Move Disk A (from Peg L) onto Disk D (on Peg M).
35. Move Disk B (on C) to Peg Left (L).
36. Move Disk A (on D) onto Disk B (on Peg L).
37. Move Disk C (from Peg R) onto Disk D (on Peg M).
38. Move Disk A (on B) to Peg Right (R).
39. Move Disk B (from Peg L) onto Disk C (on Peg M).
40. Move Disk A (from Peg R) onto Disk B (on Peg M).

### Final State
All 5 disks are successfully stacked on the **Middle (M)** peg (A on top, E on bottom). The Right (R) and Left (L) pegs are empty.
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the right peg and the left peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the left peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the right peg are empty again.
The right peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================
