            "hanoi_planner": {
                "private_information": [
                    "The puzzle involves 5 disks (A, B, C, D, E) and 3 pegs (Left, Middle, Right).",
                    "A is the smallest, E is the largest."
                ],
                "goal": "Generate the full planning specification to move all 5 disks from the Middle Peg to the Left Peg."
            },
            "auditor": {
                "private_information": [
                    "Core rule: A larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.",
                    "Rule: Only the topmost disk can be moved."
                ],
                "goal": "Audit and validate the generated plan specification against the Tower of Hanoi rules, ensuring temporal and causal consistency."
            },
            "orchestrator": {
                "private_information": [],
                "goal": "Produce the final, validated PDDL domain and problem file for the Tower of Hanoi puzzle (5 disks)."
            }
        },
        "environment": {
            "init": {
                "num_disks": 5,
                "num_pegs": 3
            },
            "public_information": [
                "The disks are A (smallest), B, C, D, E (largest).",
                "The pegs are Left, Middle, and Right.",
                "Initial State: Middle Peg holds A, B, C, D, E (top to bottom). Left and Right Pegs are empty.",
                "Goal State: Left Peg holds A, B, C, D, E (top to bottom). Middle and Right Pegs are empty.",
                "Rules: 1. Move only one disk at a time. 2. Move only the top disk. 3. Never place a larger disk on a smaller disk."
            ]
        },
        "workflow": {
            "hanoi_planner": {
                "pddl": {
                    "input": [],
                    "output": "pddl_initial_plan",
                    "system_prompt": "You are an expert in defining planning problems using PDDL (Planning Domain Definition Language). You must define the necessary actions, predicates, objects, and initial/goal conditions. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.",
                    "prompt": "Your task is to plan the solution for the Tower of Hanoi puzzle with 5 disks. You are provided with the environment details and rules:\nPublic Information:\n{environment->public_information}\nPrivate Knowledge:\n{agents->hanoi_planner->private_information}\nBased on this information, derive the necessary set of actions, predicates, objects, and initial/goal conditions required to solve this puzzle. Think step by step and generate the complete plan specification required to achieve the goal: {agents->hanoi_planner->goal}."
                }
            },
            "auditor": {
                "review": {
                    "input": [
                        "pddl_initial_plan"
                    ],
                    "output": "pddl_audited_plan",
                    "system_prompt": "You are a specialized auditor for PDDL plans, focusing on temporal and causal consistency according to strict environmental rules. Your output must be a validated PDDL Domain and Problem file, ensuring the plan is executable and legal. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.",
                    "prompt": "You have received an initial PDDL specification for the Tower of Hanoi puzzle:\n{pddl_initial_plan}\nYour goal is to audit this plan specification against the core rules of the puzzle, specifically:\n1. Ensure only the topmost disk is moved.\n2. Crucially, verify that the planning logic prevents placing a larger disk on a smaller disk, maintaining the relative size ordering.\nReview the received domain and problem definitions. Adjust the specification if necessary to ensure validity and adherence to the constraints defined in:\n{agents->auditor->private_information}\nOutput the final, verified PDDL structure. If the original plan is sound, reproduce it exactly."
                }
            },
            "orchestrator": {
                "pddl": {
                    "input": [
                        "pddl_audited_plan"
                    ],
                    "output": "pddl_final_solution",
                    "system_prompt": "You are an expert orchestrator for planning solutions, specializing in finalizing PDDL outputs for execution by the FastDownwards solver. You always provide a complete, validated PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.",
                    "prompt": "You have received the audited PDDL plan for the Tower of Hanoi task:\n{pddl_audited_plan}\nReview this structure to ensure it is standardized, complete, and ready for a PDDL solver. Your final output must strictly follow the required PDDL syntax and accurately reflect the goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}.\nThink step by step and and provide the final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file."
                }
            },
            "constraints": [
                "hanoi_planner.pddl->auditor.review",
                "auditor.review->orchestrator.pddl"
            ]
        }
    },
    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        disk - object\n        peg - object\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) \n        (on-peg ?d - disk ?p - peg)\n        (clear ?d - disk)\n        (base-clear ?p - peg)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost) - number\n    )\n\n    ; A. Move D from Disk Y onto Disk Z (Disk -> Disk)\n    (:action move_d_d_to_d\n        :parameters (?d ?y ?z - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?z)\n            (on ?d ?y)\n            (smaller ?d ?z) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?y))\n            (on ?d ?z)\n            (not (clear ?z))\n            (clear ?y)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ; B. Move D from Peg P_from base onto Disk Z (Peg -> Disk)\n    (:action move_d_p_to_d\n        :parameters (?d ?z - disk ?p_from - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?z)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n            (smaller ?d ?z) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?z)\n            (not (clear ?z))\n            (base-clear ?p_from)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; C. Move D from Disk Y onto Peg P_to base (Disk -> Peg)\n    (:action move_d_d_to_p\n        :parameters (?d ?y - disk ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (base-clear ?p_to)\n            (on ?d ?y) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?y))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_to)\n            (not (base-clear ?p_to))\n            (clear ?y)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; D. Move D from Peg P_from base onto Peg P_to base (Peg -> Peg)\n    (:action move_d_p_to_p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (base-clear ?p_to)\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_from)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on-peg ?d ?p_from))\n            (on-peg ?d ?p_to)\n            (not (base-clear ?p_to))\n            (base-clear ?p_from)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-m-to-l)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        Left Middle Right - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n\n        (on-peg E Middle)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n\n        (clear A)\n        (base-clear Left)\n        (base-clear Right)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        (on-peg E Left)\n        (on D E)\n        (on C D)\n        (on B C)\n        (on A B)\n        \n        (base-clear Middle)\n        (base-clear Right)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",
    "pddl_plan": "No plan found.",
    "syntax_errors": "terminate called after throwing an instance of 'parser::pddl::UnexpectedEOF'\n  what():  Unexpected EOF found\nAborted (core dumped)\n",
    "pddl_logs": "INFO     planner time limit: None\nINFO     planner memory limit: None\n\nINFO     Running translator.\nINFO     translator stdin: None\nINFO     translator time limit: None\nINFO     translator memory limit: None\nINFO     translator command line string: /home/emanuele/MultiAgentPlanning/.venv/bin/python3 /home/emanuele/MultiAgentPlanning/solvers/fast-downward-24.06.1/builds/release/bin/translate/translate.py results/hanoi/hanoi_medium/hanoi_medium/FastDownwards/BlocksworldMediumScaling14/domain_2.pddl results/hanoi/hanoi_medium/hanoi_medium/FastDownwards/BlocksworldMediumScaling14/problem_2.pddl --sas-file output.sas\nParsing...\nError: Could not parse domain file: results/hanoi/hanoi_medium/hanoi_medium/FastDownwards/BlocksworldMediumScaling14/domain_2.pddl\nReason: Missing ')'\ntranslate exit code: 31\n\nDriver aborting after translate\nINFO     Planner time: 0.08s\n",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_4
------------------------------
This is the sequence of 40 actions required to move all five disks (A, B, C, D, E) from the Middle Peg to the Left Peg, following the constraints of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle.

**Goal:** Move the entire stack from the Middle Peg to the Left Peg.

1.  Move Disk A from Middle Peg to Right Peg.
2.  Move Disk B from Middle Peg to Left Peg.
3.  Move Disk A from Right Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk B).
4.  Move Disk C from Middle Peg to Right Peg.
5.  Move Disk A from Left Peg (on B) to Middle Peg (onto Disk D).
6.  Move Disk B from Left Peg to Right Peg (onto Disk C).
7.  Move Disk A from Middle Peg (on D) to Right Peg (onto Disk B).
8.  Move Disk A from Right Peg (on B) to Left Peg.
9.  Move Disk B from Right Peg (on C) to Middle Peg (onto Disk D).
10. Move Disk A from Left Peg to Middle Peg (onto Disk B).
11. Move Disk C from Right Peg to Left Peg.
12. Move Disk A from Middle Peg (on B) to Right Peg.
13. Move Disk B from Middle Peg (on D) to Left Peg (onto Disk C).
14. Move Disk A from Right Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk B).
15. Move Disk D from Middle Peg to Right Peg.
16. Move Disk A from Left Peg (on B) to Middle Peg (onto Disk E).
17. Move Disk A from Middle Peg (on E) to Right Peg (onto Disk D).
18. Move Disk B from Left Peg (on C) to Middle Peg (onto Disk E).
19. Move Disk A from Right Peg (on D) to Middle Peg (onto Disk B).
20. Move Disk C from Left Peg to Right Peg (onto Disk D).
21. Move Disk A from Middle Peg (on B) to Left Peg.
22. Move Disk B from Middle Peg (on E) to Right Peg (onto Disk C).
23. Move Disk A from Left Peg to Right Peg (onto Disk B).
24. Move Disk E from Middle Peg to Left Peg.
25. Move Disk A from Right Peg (on B) to Middle Peg.
26. Move Disk B from Right Peg (on C) to Left Peg (onto Disk E).
27. Move Disk A from Middle Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk B).
28. Move Disk C from Right Peg (on D) to Middle Peg.
29. Move Disk A from Left Peg (on B) to Right Peg (onto Disk D).
30. Move Disk B from Left Peg (on E) to Middle Peg (onto Disk C).
31. Move Disk A from Right Peg (on D) to Middle Peg (onto Disk B).
32. Move Disk D from Right Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk E).
33. Move Disk A from Middle Peg (on B) to Right Peg.
34. Move Disk A from Right Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk D).
35. Move Disk B from Middle Peg (on C) to Right Peg.
36. Move Disk A from Left Peg (on D) to Right Peg (onto Disk B).
37. Move Disk C from Middle Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk D).
38. Move Disk A from Right Peg (on B) to Middle Peg.
39. Move Disk B from Right Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk C).
40. Move Disk A from Middle Peg to Left Peg (onto Disk B).
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the middle peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.

The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions)\n    (:types\n        disk\n        peg\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is smaller than d2 (Static relation)\n        \n        ; Stacking relations\n        (on ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)      ; d1 is immediately on d2\n        (is-bottom ?d - disk ?p - peg)  ; d is on the base of peg p\n        \n        ; Clearance states\n        (clear ?d - disk)               ; d has nothing on top of it\n        (empty ?p - peg)                ; p has no disks on it\n    )\n\n    ; 1. Move disk D, sitting on D_under, onto D_top\n    (:action move-disk-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg ?d_under - disk ?d_top - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_under) ; D is lifted from D_under\n            (clear ?d_top)   ; D_top is receiving D\n            (smaller ?d ?d_top) ; Size constraint: D must be smaller than D_top\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Lift D\n            (not (on ?d ?d_under))\n            (clear ?d_under)\n            \n            ; Place D\n            (on ?d ?d_top)\n            (not (clear ?d_top))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 2. Move disk D, sitting on peg base P_from, onto D_top\n    (:action move-bottom-disk-to-disk\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg ?d_top - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (is-bottom ?d ?p_from) ; D is lifted from P_from base\n            (clear ?d_top)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_top)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Lift D\n            (not (is-bottom ?d ?p_from))\n            (empty ?p_from) ; P_from becomes empty\n            \n            ; Place D\n            (on ?d ?d_top)\n            (not (clear ?d_top))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 3. Move disk D, sitting on D_under, onto empty peg P_to\n    (:action move-disk-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg ?d_under - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?d_under)\n            (empty ?p_to) ; P_to is empty\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Lift D\n            (not (on ?d ?d_under))\n            (clear ?d_under)\n            \n            ; Place D\n            (is-bottom ?d ?p_to)\n            (not (empty ?p_to))\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; 4. Move disk D, sitting on peg base P_from, onto empty peg P_to\n    (:action move-bottom-disk-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (is-bottom ?d ?p_from)\n            (empty ?p_to)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            ; Lift D\n            (not (is-bottom ?d ?p_from))\n            (empty ?p_from)\n            \n            ; Place D\n            (is-bottom ?d ?p_to)\n            (not (empty ?p_to))\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5-disk-R-to-M)\n    (:domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:objects\n        A B C D E - disk\n        L M R - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; Static Size Relations: A < B < C < D < E\n        (smaller A B) (smaller A C) (smaller A D) (smaller A E)\n        (smaller B C) (smaller B D) (smaller B E)\n        (smaller C D) (smaller C E)\n        (smaller D E)\n        \n        ; Initial State: All disks on R (A top, E bottom)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (is-bottom E R)\n        \n        ; Initial Clearance\n        (clear A)\n        \n        ; Empty pegs\n        (empty L)\n        (empty M)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Goal State: All disks on M (A top, E bottom)\n        (on A B)\n        (on B C)\n        (on C D)\n        (on D E)\n        (is-bottom E M)\n        \n        ; Other pegs must be empty\n        (empty L)\n        (empty R)\n    ))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",
    "pddl_plan": "(move-disk-to-peg a m l b)\n(move-disk-to-peg b l m c)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk a l m b)\n(move-disk-to-peg c m l d)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m b d)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk b m l c)\n(move-disk-to-peg a l m d)\n(move-disk-to-disk b l m c d)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk a m l b)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-peg c l m)\n(move-disk-to-peg a m l b)\n(move-disk-to-disk b l m d c)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk a l m b)\n(move-disk-to-peg d m l e)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m b e)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m e d)\n(move-disk-to-disk b l m c e)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m d b)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk c m l d)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m b c)\n(move-disk-to-peg a l m c)\n(move-disk-to-disk b l m e c)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk a m l b)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-peg e r m)\n(move-disk-to-peg a l r b)\n(move-disk-to-disk b l m c e)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk a r l b)\n(move-disk-to-peg c l r d)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m b d)\n(move-disk-to-disk b l m e c)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m d b)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk d l m e)\n(move-disk-to-peg a m l b)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk a l m d)\n(move-disk-to-peg b m l c)\n(move-disk-to-disk a l m d b)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk c r l d)\n(move-disk-to-peg a l r b)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk b l m c)\n(move-bottom-disk-to-disk a r l b)\n; cost = 40 (unit cost)\n",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_2
------------------------------
This is the sequence of 40 moves required to solve the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, transferring all disks from the Right peg (R) to the Middle peg (M).

### Hanoi 5-Disk Puzzle Solution (R to M)

1.  Move disk A from Peg R onto Peg L.
2.  Move disk B from Peg R onto Peg M.
3.  Move disk A from Peg L onto disk B on Peg M.
4.  Move disk C from Peg R onto Peg L.
5.  Move disk A from disk B on Peg M onto disk D on Peg R.
6.  Move disk B from Peg M onto disk C on Peg L.
7.  Move disk A from disk D on Peg R onto Peg M.
8.  Move disk B from disk C on Peg L onto disk D on Peg R.
9.  Move disk A from Peg M onto disk B on Peg R.
10. Move disk C from Peg L onto Peg M.
11. Move disk A from disk B on Peg R onto Peg L.
12. Move disk B from disk D on Peg R onto disk C on Peg M.
13. Move disk A from Peg L onto disk B on Peg M.
14. Move disk D from disk E on Peg R onto Peg L.
15. Move disk A from disk B on Peg M onto disk E on Peg R.
16. Move disk A from disk E on Peg R onto disk D on Peg L.
17. Move disk B from disk C on Peg M onto disk E on Peg R.
18. Move disk A from disk D on Peg L onto disk B on Peg R.
19. Move disk C from Peg M onto disk D on Peg L.
20. Move disk A from disk B on Peg R onto disk C on Peg L.
21. Move disk A from disk C on Peg L onto Peg M.
22. Move disk B from disk E on Peg R onto disk C on Peg L.
23. Move disk A from Peg M onto disk B on Peg R.
24. Move disk E from Peg R onto Peg M.
25. Move disk A from disk B on Peg R onto Peg L.
26. Move disk B from disk C on Peg L onto disk E on Peg M.
27. Move disk A from Peg L onto disk B on Peg M.
28. Move disk C from disk D on Peg L onto Peg R.
29. Move disk A from disk B on Peg M onto disk D on Peg L.
30. Move disk B from disk E on Peg M onto disk C on Peg R.
31. Move disk A from disk D on Peg L onto disk B on Peg R.
32. Move disk D from Peg L onto disk E on Peg M.
33. Move disk A from disk B on Peg R onto Peg L.
34. Move disk A from Peg L onto disk D on Peg M.
35. Move disk B from disk C on Peg R onto Peg L.
36. Move disk A from disk D on Peg M onto disk B on Peg L.
37. Move disk C from Peg R onto disk D on Peg M.
38. Move disk A from disk B on Peg L onto Peg R.
39. Move disk B from Peg L onto disk C on Peg M.
40. Move disk A from Peg R onto disk B on Peg M.
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]
================================================================================

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        item\n        disk - item\n        peg - item\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?b - item) ; d is directly on base b (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - item)        ; x is the topmost item\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is strictly smaller than d2\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ; Action 1: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Disk B_to\n    (:action move-d-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?b_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?b_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?b_to) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than the disk it moves onto\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (on ?d ?b_to)\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?b_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 2: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Peg P_to\n    (:action move-d-to-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p_to) ; Target peg must be empty\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (on ?d ?p_to)\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 3: Move Disk D from Peg P_from to Disk B_to\n    (:action move-p-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?b_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?b_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?b_to) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than the disk it moves onto\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?b_to)\n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?b_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 4: Move Disk D from Peg P_from to Peg P_to\n    (:action move-p-to-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p_to)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?p_to)\n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5)\n    (:domain hanoi)\n    (:objects\n        a b c d e - disk\n        peg_l peg_m peg_r - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size hierarchy: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller a b) (smaller a c) (smaller a d) (smaller a e)\n        (smaller b c) (smaller b d) (smaller b e)\n        (smaller c d) (smaller c e)\n        (smaller d e)\n\n        ; --- Initial Stack on peg_M (A top, E bottom) ---\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_m)\n\n        ; --- Initial Clearance ---\n        (clear a)\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_r)\n\n        ; Metric initialization\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Target stack on peg_R\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_r)\n        \n        ; Ensure peg_L and peg_M are empty (clear base)\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_m)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        item\n        disk - item\n        peg - item\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?b - item) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than the disk it moves onto\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?b_to)\n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?b_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ;     "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5)\n    (:domain hanoi)\n    (:objects\n        a b c d e - disk\n        peg_l peg_m peg_r - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size hierarchy: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller a b) (smaller a c) (smaller a d) (smaller a e)\n        (smaller b c) (smaller b d) (smaller b e)\n        (smaller c d) (smaller c e)\n        (smaller d e)\n\n        ; --- Initial Stack on peg_M (A top, E bottom) ---\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_m)\n\n        ; --- Initial Clearance ---\n        (clear a)\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_r)\n\n        ; Metric initialization\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Target stack on peg_R (A/B/C/D/E stack configuration)\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_r)\n        \n        ; Ensure peg_L and peg_M are empty (clear base)\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_m)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",

d is directly on base b (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - item)        ; x is the topmost item (disk or peg if empty)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is strictly smaller than d2\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ; d is directly on base b (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - item)        ; x is the topmost item (disk or peg if empty)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is strictly smaller than d2\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ; Constraint: D must be smaller than the disk it moves onto\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (on ?d ?b_to)\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?b_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 2: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Peg P_to (Disk onto Peg)\n    (:action move-d-to-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p_to) ; d is directly on base b (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - item)        ; x is the topmost item (disk or peg if empty)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is strictly smaller than d2\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ; Action 1: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Disk B_to (Disk onto Disk)\n    (:action move-d-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?b_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?b_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?b_to) ; From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.\nAs initial conditions I have that, the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the right peg are empty.\nMy goal is to have that the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the middle peg and the left peg are empty again.\nThe left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.\n\nMy plan is as follows:\n\n[PLAN]",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        item\n        disk - item\n        peg - item\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?b - item) ; d is directly on base b (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - item)        ; x is the topmost item (disk or peg if empty)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is strictly smaller than d2\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ; Action 1: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Disk B_to (Disk onto Disk)\n    (:action move-d-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?b_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?b_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?b_to) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than the disk it moves onto\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (on ?d ?b_to)\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?b_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 2: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Peg P_to (Disk onto Peg)\n    (:action move-d-to-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p_to) ; Action 4: Move Disk D from Peg P_from to Peg P_to (Peg onto Peg)\n    (:action move-p-to-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p_to)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?p_to)\n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi)\n    (:requirements :strips :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        item\n        disk - item\n        peg - item\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?b - item) ; d is directly on base b (disk or peg)\n        (clear ?x - item)        ; x is the topmost item (disk or peg if empty)\n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk) ; d1 is strictly smaller than d2\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n\n    ; Action 1: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Disk B_to (Disk onto Disk)\n    (:action move-d-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?b_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?b_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?b_to) ;     "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5)\n    (:domain hanoi)\n    (:objects\n        a b c d e - disk\n        peg_l peg_m peg_r - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size hierarchy: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller a b) (smaller a c) (smaller a d) (smaller a e)\n        (smaller b c) (smaller b d) (smaller b e)\n        (smaller c d) (smaller c e)\n        (smaller d e)\n\n        ; --- Initial Stack on peg_M (A top, E bottom) ---\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_m)\n\n        ; --- Initial Clearance ---\n        (clear a)\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_r)\n\n        ; Metric initialization\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Target stack on peg_R (A/B/C/D/E stack configuration)\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_r)\n        \n        ; Ensure peg_L and peg_M are empty\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_m)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",

Action 1: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Disk B_to (Disk onto Disk)\n    (:action move-d-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?b_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?b_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?b_to) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than the disk it moves onto\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (on ?d ?b_to)\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?b_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 2: Move Disk D from Disk B_from to Peg P_to (Disk onto Peg)\n    (:action move-d-to-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - disk ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p_to) ; Target peg must be empty\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (on ?d ?p_to)\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 3: Move Disk D from Peg P_from to Disk B_to (Peg onto Disk)\n    (:action move-p-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?b_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?b_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?b_to) ; Constraint: D must be smaller than the disk it moves onto\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?b_to)\n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?b_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n\n    ; Action 4: Move Disk D from Peg P_from to Peg P_to (Peg onto Peg)\n    (:action move-p-to-p\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?p_from - peg ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (on ?d ?p_from)\n            (clear ?d)\n            (clear ?p_to)\n            (not (= ?p_from ?p_to))\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?p_from))\n            (on ?d ?p_to)\n            (clear ?p_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",
    "pddl_problem": "(define (problem hanoi-5)\n    (:domain hanoi)\n    (:objects\n        a b c d e - disk\n        peg_l peg_m peg_r - peg\n    )\n    (:init\n        ; --- Size hierarchy: A < B < C < D < E ---\n        (smaller a b) (smaller a c) (smaller a d) (smaller a e)\n        (smaller b c) (smaller b d) (smaller b e)\n        (smaller c d) (smaller c e)\n        (smaller d e)\n\n        ; --- Initial Stack on peg_M (A top, E bottom) ---\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_m)\n\n        ; --- Initial Clearance ---\n        (clear a)\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_r)\n\n        ; Metric initialization\n        (= (total-cost) 0)\n    )\n    (:goal (and\n        ; Target stack on peg_R (A/B/C/D/E stack configuration)\n        (on a b)\n        (on b c)\n        (on c d)\n        (on d e)\n        (on e peg_r)\n        \n        ; Ensure peg_L and peg_M are empty\n        (clear peg_l)\n        (clear peg_m)\n    ))\n    (:metric minimize (total-cost))\n)",
    "target_solver": "FastDownwards",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_10
------------------------------
This sequence of instructions translates the PDDL plan for the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, moving the stack from the Middle Peg (M) to the Right Peg (R). Disks are ordered from smallest (A) to largest (E).

| Step | Action | Description |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | `(move-d-to-p a b peg_l)` | Move Disk A from Peg M (off Disk B) to Peg L. |
| 2 | `(move-d-to-p b c peg_r)` | Move Disk B from Peg M (off Disk C) to Peg R. |
| 3 | `(move-p-to-d a peg_l b)` | Move Disk A from Peg L onto Disk B (Peg R). |
| 4 | `(move-d-to-p c d peg_l)` | Move Disk C from Peg M (off Disk D) to Peg L. |
| 5 | `(move-d-to-d a b d)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg R) onto Disk D (Peg M). |
| 6 | `(move-p-to-d b peg_r c)` | Move Disk B from Peg R onto Disk C (Peg L). |
| 7 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D (Peg M) onto Disk B (Peg L). |
| 8 | `(move-d-to-p a b peg_r)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg L) to Peg R. |
| 9 | `(move-d-to-d b c d)` | Move Disk B from Disk C (Peg L) onto Disk D (Peg M). |
| 10 | `(move-p-to-d a peg_r b)` | Move Disk A from Peg R onto Disk B (Peg M). |
| 11 | `(move-p-to-p c peg_l peg_r)` | Move Disk C from Peg L to Peg R. |
| 12 | `(move-d-to-p a b peg_l)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg M) to Peg L. |
| 13 | `(move-d-to-d b d c)` | Move Disk B from Disk D (Peg M) onto Disk C (Peg R). |
| 14 | `(move-p-to-d a peg_l b)` | Move Disk A from Peg L onto Disk B (Peg R). |
| 15 | `(move-d-to-p d e peg_l)` | Move Disk D from Peg M (off Disk E) to Peg L. |
| 16 | `(move-d-to-d a b e)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg R) onto Disk E (Peg M). |
| 17 | `(move-d-to-d a e d)` | Move Disk A from Disk E (Peg M) onto Disk D (Peg L). |
| 18 | `(move-d-to-d b c e)` | Move Disk B from Disk C (Peg R) onto Disk E (Peg M). |
| 19 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D (Peg L) onto Disk B (Peg M). |
| 20 | `(move-p-to-d c peg_r d)` | Move Disk C from Peg R onto Disk D (Peg L). |
| 21 | `(move-d-to-p a b peg_r)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg M) to Peg R. |
| 22 | `(move-d-to-d b e c)` | Move Disk B from Disk E (Peg M) onto Disk C (Peg L). |
| 23 | `(move-p-to-d a peg_r b)` | Move Disk A from Peg R onto Disk B (Peg L). |
| 24 | `(move-p-to-p e peg_m peg_r)` | Move Disk E from Peg M to Peg R. |
| 25 | `(move-d-to-p a b peg_m)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg L) to Peg M. |
| 26 | `(move-d-to-d b c e)` | Move Disk B from Disk C (Peg L) onto Disk E (Peg R). |
| 27 | `(move-p-to-d a peg_m b)` | Move Disk A from Peg M onto Disk B (Peg R). |
| 28 | `(move-d-to-p c d peg_m)` | Move Disk C from Disk D (Peg L) to Peg M. |
| 29 | `(move-d-to-d a b d)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg R) onto Disk D (Peg L). |
| 30 | `(move-d-to-d b e c)` | Move Disk B from Disk E (Peg R) onto Disk C (Peg M). |
| 31 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D (Peg L) onto Disk B (Peg M). |
| 32 | `(move-p-to-d d peg_l e)` | Move Disk D from Peg L onto Disk E (Peg R). |
| 33 | `(move-d-to-p a b peg_l)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg M) to Peg L. |
| 34 | `(move-p-to-d a peg_l d)` | Move Disk A from Peg L onto Disk D (Peg R). |
| 35 | `(move-d-to-p b c peg_l)` | Move Disk B from Disk C (Peg M) to Peg L. |
| 36 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D (Peg R) onto Disk B (Peg L). |
| 37 | `(move-p-to-d c peg_m d)` | Move Disk C from Peg M onto Disk D (Peg R). |
| 38 | `(move-d-to-p a b peg_m)` | Move Disk A from Disk B (Peg L) to Peg M. |
| 39 | `(move-p-to-d b peg_l c)` | Move Disk B from Peg L onto Disk C (Peg R). |
| 40 | `(move-p-to-d a peg_m b)` | Move Disk A from Peg M onto Disk B (Peg R). |

**Goal Achieved:** All disks are stacked A through E on the Right Peg (peg_R). (Total 40 moves).
================================================================================


PROBLEM
------------------------------
I am practicing the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Here is the action I can do

Move the top disk from one peg to another peg

I must obey the following rules:
I can move only one disk at a time.
I may only move a disk that is on top of a peg.
I can never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Once a disk is moved, it keeps its relative size ordering with the others.

[STATEMENT]
There are 5 disks in total. From smallest to largest they are disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E.
As initial conditions I have that, the right peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, while the left peg and the middle peg are empty.
My goal is to have that the middle peg holds, from top to bottom, disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, and disk E, and both the right peg and the left peg are empty again.
The left peg can be used as an intermediate parking spot but must end up empty.

My plan is as follows:

[PLAN]

    "pddl_domain": "(define (domain hanoi-5-disks)\n    (:requirements :typing :negative-preconditions :action-costs)\n    (:types\n        disk peg - base\n    )\n    (:predicates\n        (on ?d - disk ?b - base) \n        (clear ?b - base) \n        (smaller ?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk)\n    )\n    (:functions\n        (total-cost)\n    )\n    \n    ; Action 1: Move D from B_FROM onto D_TO (D_TO is a disk). Requires size check.\n    (:action move-d-to-d\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - base ?d_to - disk)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?d_to)\n            (smaller ?d ?d_to) \n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?d_to))\n            (on ?d ?d_to)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n    \n    ; Action 2: Move D from B_FROM onto P_TO (P_TO is an empty peg). No size check against the peg itself.\n    (:action move-d-to-peg\n        :parameters (?d - disk ?b_from - base ?p_to - peg)\n        :precondition (and\n            (clear ?d)\n            (on ?d ?b_from)\n            (clear ?p_to)\n        )\n        :effect (and\n            (not (on ?d ?b_from))\n            (clear ?b_from)\n            (not (clear ?p_to))\n            (on ?d ?p_to)\n            (increase (total-cost) 1)\n        )\n    )\n)",

NATURAL-PLAN sas_plan_4
------------------------------
This plan details the sequence of 40 moves required to solve the 5-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, moving all disks from the Right Peg (R) to the Middle Peg (M). Disks are sized A (smallest) through E (largest).

| Step | Action | Description |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 1 | `(move-d-to-peg a b l)` | Move Disk A (smallest) from Disk B to the Left Peg (L). |
| 2 | `(move-d-to-peg b c m)` | Move Disk B from Disk C to the Middle Peg (M). |
| 3 | `(move-d-to-d a l b)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (L) onto Disk B. |
| 4 | `(move-d-to-peg c d l)` | Move Disk C from Disk D to the Left Peg (L). |
| 5 | `(move-d-to-d a b d)` | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk D. |
| 6 | `(move-d-to-d b m c)` | Move Disk B from the Middle Peg (M) onto Disk C. |
| 7 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 8 | `(move-d-to-peg a b m)` | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Middle Peg (M). |
| 9 | `(move-d-to-d b c d)` | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk D. |
| 10 | `(move-d-to-d a m b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg (M) onto Disk B. |
| 11 | `(move-d-to-peg c l m)` | Move Disk C from the Left Peg (L) to the Middle Peg (M). |
| 12 | `(move-d-to-peg a b l)` | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Left Peg (L). |
| 13 | `(move-d-to-d b d c)` | Move Disk B from Disk D onto Disk C. |
| 14 | `(move-d-to-d a l b)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (L) onto Disk B. |
| 15 | `(move-d-to-peg d e l)` | Move Disk D from Disk E to the Left Peg (L). |
| 16 | `(move-d-to-d a b e)` | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk E. |
| 17 | `(move-d-to-d a e d)` | Move Disk A from Disk E onto Disk D. |
| 18 | `(move-d-to-d b c e)` | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk E. |
| 19 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 20 | `(move-d-to-d c m d)` | Move Disk C from the Middle Peg (M) onto Disk D. |
| 21 | `(move-d-to-peg a b m)` | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Middle Peg (M). |
| 22 | `(move-d-to-d b e c)` | Move Disk B from Disk E onto Disk C. |
| 23 | `(move-d-to-d a m b)` | Move Disk A from the Middle Peg (M) onto Disk B. |
| 24 | `(move-d-to-peg e r m)` | **Move Disk E (largest) from the Right Peg (R) to the Middle Peg (M).** |
| 25 | `(move-d-to-peg a b r)` | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Right Peg (R). |
| 26 | `(move-d-to-d b c e)` | Move Disk B from Disk C onto Disk E. |
| 27 | `(move-d-to-d a r b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg (R) onto Disk B. |
| 28 | `(move-d-to-peg c d r)` | Move Disk C from Disk D to the Right Peg (R). |
| 29 | `(move-d-to-d a b d)` | Move Disk A from Disk B onto Disk D. |
| 30 | `(move-d-to-d b e c)` | Move Disk B from Disk E onto Disk C. |
| 31 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 32 | `(move-d-to-d d l e)` | Move Disk D from the Left Peg (L) onto Disk E. |
| 33 | `(move-d-to-peg a b l)` | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Left Peg (L). |
| 34 | `(move-d-to-d a l d)` | Move Disk A from the Left Peg (L) onto Disk D. |
| 35 | `(move-d-to-peg b c l)` | Move Disk B from Disk C to the Left Peg (L). |
| 36 | `(move-d-to-d a d b)` | Move Disk A from Disk D onto Disk B. |
| 37 | `(move-d-to-d c r d)` | Move Disk C from the Right Peg (R) onto Disk D. |
| 38 | `(move-d-to-peg a b r)` | Move Disk A from Disk B to the Right Peg (R). |
| 39 | `(move-d-to-d b l c)` | Move Disk B from the Left Peg (L) onto Disk C. |
| 40 | `(move-d-to-d a r b)` | Move Disk A from the Right Peg (R) onto Disk B. |

**Goal State Reached:** All disks (A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on M) are correctly stacked on the Middle Peg (M).
================================================================================
